InWorldAbduction_Gale.synopsis: In certain areas in the Undercity, Orin will abduct and impersonate a target companion. Choice of target is the same as the camp abduction, but method and impersonation is not tied to the camp.
InWorldAbduction_Gale.how_to_trigger:
To trigger the In-World Abductions1) 
CTRL+SHIFT+9 (Debug book) Go to Region -> Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> In-World Abdcution 1.
2) CTRL+SHIFT+8 (Camp debug book) - Invite Individual -> Gale
3) Walk forward a bit down the stairs and you should trigger the event. Orin-as-Gale will run towards you and start the dialog.4) If you want to try the other abduction location, you'll need to reload and use debug book to go to the other 3 locations.

PostLaezelAbduction_PAD_DeadYenna.synopsis: Orin has abductee Laezel, and is impersonating Laezel. Orin-as-Laezel has also taken Yenna hostage pretending to the players that Yenna is in fact Orin-in-disguise.During that camp-night confrontation, bad skill rolls or if players encouraged Orin-as-Laezel to kill Yenna, Yenna would be killed.This PAD is played when the players approach her dead body after the encounter.

Cultist_05.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

InWorldAbduction_Nested.synopsis: Nested dialogue. After impersonating a member of the player's camp (in camp or on entering the undercity), Orin reveals herself and delivers an ultimatum to the player: kill Gortash, or she will kill the abductee. Dark Urge players receive an alternate flow, where their shared background and rivalry is more present.

Reaper_03.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance.synopsis: The Dark Urge accepted Bhaal when he appeared. Now, Jaheira and Minsc challenge and try to take down the DU, if they were encountered and survived until this point in the game.If the Jaheira/Minsc scene cannot trigger, there will be fallback comments from the party.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance.how_to_trigger: 0) Start with Dark Urge Origin.1) With the debugbook, go to Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> Bhaal Temple Bridge.2) Defeat Orin.3) Accept Bhaal's demands.

DeathsHead_01.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

Reaper_02.synopsis: A Bhaal Reaper in the Temple of Bhaal.

Cultist_04.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

DeathsHead_02_AD_DarkUrgeDuel.synopsis: In the Bhaal Temple, if players are Dark Urge, they have the opportunity to fight Orin one on one. Players are given a warning that if the companions jump in the battle, so does the rest of the temple.
DeathsHead_02_AD_DarkUrgeDuel.how_to_trigger: 1) First node is triggered when DU has Accepted Bhaal and encounter the Jaheira+Minsc Confrontation. When combat begins with them, Some cultists will join the DU against them.2) Second node is when the Dark Urge dies in the duel, this AD plays and rest of combat NPC joins in to kill remaining companions.3) Thrid node happens when players broke the Duel.4) Fourth node triggers at the beginning of the duel.

Reaper_05.synopsis: A Bhaal Reaper in the Temple of Bhaal.

UnholyAssassin_02.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

Cultist_03.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal. This one is a cannibal.

NightBlade_01.synopsis: A Bhaal Reaper in the Temple of Bhaal.

Cultist_02.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

AD_AdmiringKill_01.synopsis: In Bhaal Temple, Orin would display her kills for other Bhaalist and to honour Bhaal himself with the kills. She kills not just for fun, but she sees murder as an artform.If Orin has impersonated 2 person in Wyrm's Crossing (possible targets The Smith, The Journalist, The DyingAttacker, or The Flaming Fist), their bodies will end up in Bhaal Temple.2 Bhaalist NPCs will comment and facinate over the way she has killed the victims.In the edge-case where Orin might not have impersonated anyone in Wyrm's Crossing, a random citizen's body will be used on display instead.

PostBattle_PAD_AbducteeKilled.synopsis: In the Bhaal Temple, Orin may kill the abductee during dialog due to a failed Skillcheck or players encouraging her to kill them.This is the PAD that plays reacting to the dead abductee after the battle.The abductee could be Laezel, Minthara, Gale, Halsin or Yenna.

Reaper_04.synopsis: A Bhaal Reaper in the Temple of Bhaal.

PostBattleDarkUrge.synopsis: Orin, Chosen of Bhaal, has died by the DarkUrge's/party's hands.If the DU deafted Orin, Bhaal will celebrate his new Chosen and force a decision on them - accept him, or he will reclaim his blood from them.If the player was defeated, the player sees a linear scene where Bhaal inflicts his blood on them, leaving them with the urge to kill, but not his slayer powers.
PostBattleDarkUrge.how_to_trigger: 0) Start with Dark Urge Origin.1) With the debugbook, go to Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> Bhaal Temple Bridge.2) Defeat Orin.

DeathsHead_04.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

ExamineAbductee.synopsis: Orin has abducted a companion. They lie knocked out on the Bhaal Temple altar.

Cultist_01.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

AD_AdmiringKill_02.synopsis: In Bhaal Temple, Orin would display her kills for other Bhaalist and to honour Bhaal himself with the kills. She kills not just for fun, but she sees murder as an artform.If Orin has impersonated 2 person in Wyrm's Crossing (possible targets The Smith, The Journalist, The DyingAttacker, or The Flaming Fist), their bodies will end up in Bhaal Temple.2 Bhaalist NPCs will comment and facinate over the way she has killed the victims.In the edge-case where Orin might not have impersonated anyone in Wyrm's Crossing, a random citizen's body will be used on display instead.

UnholyAssassin_01.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

PostLaezelAbduction_AD_YennaCat.synopsis: Orin has abductee Laezel, and is impersonating Laezel. Orin-as-Laezel has also taken Yenna hostage pretending to the players that Yenna is in fact Orin-in-disguise.During that camp-night confrontation, bad skill rolls or if players encouraged Orin-as-Laezel to kill Yenna, Yenna would be killed.This AD is played when Yenna's cat appears out of sight and dutifully sits down next to her dead body.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead.synopsis: Orin has abductee Laezel, and is impersonating Laezel. Orin-as-Laezel has also taken Yenna hostage pretending to the players that Yenna is in fact Orin-in-disguise.During that camp-night confrontation, bad skill rolls or if players encouraged Orin-as-Laezel to kill Yenna, Yenna would be killed.This is the SwD for this encounter on Yenna's body to get a little more information about what really happened.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara.synopsis: In certain areas in the Undercity, Orin will abduct and impersonate a target companion. Choice of target is the same as the camp abduction, but method and impersonation is not tied to the camp.
InWorldAbduction_Minthara.how_to_trigger:
To trigger the In-World Abductions1) 
CTRL+SHIFT+9 (Debug book) Go to Region -> Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> In-World Abdcution 1.
2) CTRL+SHIFT+8 (Camp debug book) - Invite Individual -> Minthara
3) Walk forward a bit down the stairs and you should trigger the event. Orin-as-Minthara will run towards you and start the dialog.4) If you want to try the other abduction location, you'll need to reload and use debug book to go to the other 3 locations.

OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee.synopsis: In Bhaal Temple, Orin does a short 'patrol' around the altar where the abductee is tied up. She starts from the altar, 'inspects/toys' with the bound abductee, then walks over to her minions and talks with them briefly. She continues this patrol indefinitely with some randomness to her timing, allowing the players to try to plan/time the rescue stealthily.This is the AD that plays when she is 'toying' with the abductee.

AD_AwakenAbductee.synopsis: This dialog will play in 3 different circumstances.1) Players unlocked the abductee stealthily before the dialog with Orin. Which would trigger a dialog with Orin. After that dialog with Orin, the abductee will wake up and play this AD. Combat than begins. Yenna would run away, companions will join players as a follower.2) Players have entered combat with Orin, and during combat, they unlock the abductee. In which case they will awaken immediately and play this AD. Yenna runs away, companion joins as follower.3) Player have defeated Orin and unlock the altar, in which case they are all in relatively safe enviroment. Yenna would not need to run away, companion would not need to join as follower.During combat, players attempt to rescue the victim. When the players unlock the altar, the victim is awakened and plays this AD as they are awakened.If the victim is a player companion, they join combat as an AI NPC.If the victim is Yenna she runs away.

PostBattleAbductee.synopsis: After the companion or Yenna, survives the battle with Orin. They would leave the party as a temporary follower and take some time to recover from their ordeal before returning to camp.In Yenna's case, she will reappear after hiding somewhere safe during the combat.Players can talk to them briefly before they return to camp where the companion/Yenna will also disappear from the temple back to camp.
PostBattleAbductee.how_to_trigger: 1) Start game as DU2) Go to Bhaal Temple3) Talk to Orin by getting spotted.4) Make sure abductee isn't killed in dialog with skillchecks.5) Defeat Orin.6) PostBattleDarkUrge should trigger.7) Resist Bhaal when he offers DU to be chosen one.8) DU dies, Withers appears and resurrects everyone.9) Abductee would also be awakened from the altar (if they survived the battle).10) Talk to Abductee.

Reaper_06.synopsis: A Bhaal Reaper in the Temple of Bhaal.

AD_ButlerDarkUrge.synopsis: The Dark Urge's butler is waiting in front of the door to the Bhaal Temple. Upon spotting the players, the butler will greet the players with this AD.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel.synopsis: In certain areas in the Undercity, Orin will abduct and impersonate a target companion. Choice of target is the same as the camp abduction, but method and impersonation is not tied to the camp.
InWorldAbduction_Laezel.how_to_trigger:
To trigger the In-World Abductions1) 
CTRL+SHIFT+9 (Debug book) Go to Region -> Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> In-World Abdcution 1.
2) CTRL+SHIFT+8 (Camp debug book) - Invite Individual -> Minthara
3) Walk forward a bit down the stairs and you should trigger the event. Orin-as-Minthara will run towards you and start the dialog.4) If you want to try the other abduction location, you'll need to reload and use debug book to go to the other 3 locations.

LINE_DarkUrgeDefeated.synopsis: When players, as the Dark Urge, accept a duel with Orin. And the companions honour the deal of not getting involved in the battle. And the DU was defeated by Orin.This dialog will start. Upon which Orin will want to sacrifice the remaining players with the rest of the temple.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna.synopsis: Orin abductions Laezel. In the CFM, Orin-Laezel takes Yenna as hostage. Players could encourage Orin-Laezel to murder Yenna. But this dialog is when players spared her and talked to her after the encounter.
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna.how_to_trigger: 1) Go to Act 3 -> Bhaal Temple.2) oe BTEnableAbduction3) Open Camp Debug book and add Laezel into camp.4) Go to camp or LongRest.5) Orin as Laezel with Yenna will appear in a Campfire Moment camp night.6) In the dialog with Orin-Laezel, do NOT provoke Orin to kill Yenna.7) Yenna survives after Orin leaves.8) Talk to Yenna.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions.synopsis: In Bhaal Temple, Orin does a short 'patrol' around the altar where the abductee is tied up. She starts from the altar, 'inspects/toys' with the bound abductee, then walks over to her minions and talks with them briefly. She continues this patrol indefinitely with some randomness to her timing, allowing the players to try to plan/time the rescue stealthily.This is the AD that triggers when she talks to her nearby minions. Its planned not to repeat sequencially but start randomily with different greeting nodes.

PostBattle.synopsis: Orin, Chosen of Bhaal has died by the hands of players.
PostBattle.how_to_trigger: 0) Start with Dark Urge Origin.1) With the debugbook, go to Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> Bhaal Temple Bridge.2) Defeat Orin with non-Dark Urge character.

OrinsMother_Dead.synopsis: Sarevok is both Orin's grandfather and father. Orin's mother was his favourite, and he wanted her to become the next Chosen. Ordering her to sacrifice Orin to Bhaal. Orin defended herself and instead killed her own mother and in turn became the Chosen.Sarevok has presevered Orin's mothers body in a secret chamber in the Bhaal Temple, where players can discover it.
OrinsMother_Dead.how_to_trigger: 1) Goto 95.957; -60.46; 1018.412) Open debug book CTRL+SHFT+93) Choose option 7: Useful Spells4) Choose Speak with Dead.5) Use speak with dead spell on body.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin.synopsis: In certain areas in the Undercity, Orin will abduct and impersonate a target companion. Choice of target is the same as the camp abduction, but method and impersonation is not tied to the camp.
InWorldAbduction_Halsin.how_to_trigger:
To trigger the In-World Abductions1) 
CTRL+SHIFT+9 (Debug book) Go to Region -> Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> In-World Abdcution 1.
2) CTRL+SHIFT+8 (Camp debug book) - Invite Individual -> Halsin
3) Walk forward a bit down the stairs and you should trigger the event. Orin-as-Halsin will run towards you and start the dialog.4) If you want to try the other abduction location, you'll need to reload and use debug book to go to the other 3 locations.

PAD_FoundOrinsLetter.synopsis: When players have encountered Orin and had a companion abducted, Orin would have given the players an ultimatum.Orin will send messages to the players at key points.1) When players first fight a Steel Watch at the end of that combat.2) When players have destroyed the Steel Watch Foundry.3) When players have killed Gortash.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst.synopsis: Triggers when the Orin's stone is - picked up by the DarkUrge- is first stone to be picked up (as opposed to Gortash's stone picked up first).
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst.how_to_trigger: 1) Start new game with Dark Urge2) Go to Act 3 -> Bhaal Temple3) Talk to door or oe BTForceOpenDoor4) Defeat Orin5) Go through all the post battle dialogs.6) Depending on choice, will automatically get the netherstone or have to loot Orin's body for the Netherstone Dagger to get the Netherstone.7) If her stone is the first one before Gortash, dialog will trigger.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance.synopsis: Orin, Chosen of Bhaal lays dead by the Dark Urge. Bhaal has given his terms to the Dark Urge. Players has rejected Bhaal and died in the process.Players will reappear in camp.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance.how_to_trigger: 0) Start with Dark Urge Origin.1) With the debugbook, go to Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> Bhaal Temple Bridge.2) Defeat Orin.3) Defy Bhaal's demands.

DeathsHead_02.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

Reaper_01.synopsis: A Bhaal Reaper in the Temple of Bhaal.

PAD_FindDarkUrgeBody.synopsis: Non-Dark Urge playthrough will be able to discover a body that looks like the default Dark Urge character from character creation. Companions will remark how Orin took her time torturing this person - they had a really long and painful death.

PAD_EnterOrinsRoom.synopsis: Players enter Orin's room for the first time. Companions remark about it. Maybe Minsc/Jaheira can say something about how they destroyed the old temple/room, and Orin rebuilt it to be worst than what they remembered.

DeathsHead_03.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

MainDoor.synopsis: The Bhaal Temple is closed off by a massive door. They are 3 ways to open the door.1) with an Bhaal Amulet, given in the Serial Killer situation2) with invitation from Orin - which is given when players killed Gortash, after she has given the players the ultimatum3) if players are the Dark Urge, their butler will freely open the doors for the players.
MainDoor.how_to_trigger: 1) Go to Act 3 -> UnderCity -> Bhaal Temple Bridge2a) Use oe BTGiveBhaalAmulet to give players Bhaal Amulet.or2b) Use oe BTSetKilledGortash to set players have killed Gortash so players are invited.2c) Players start as Dark Urge origins, and therefore their Butler will be at the door letting them in.3) Go to approach and 'speak' to the door.

AD_CombatStart.synopsis: Normally, Orin will try to spot for players so she can start a dialog with them.At the end of the dialog with her, she normally turns into the Slayer in cinematic then combat ensues. ('Normally', because there is an edgecase in DU path that Orin can't turn into a Slayer if the DU already has the slayer form).But players can immediately attack Orin before her dialog and therefore miss the whole turn into slayer transformation.This AD is for 2 circumstances :-1) Players attack Orin before she spots them, therefore never entering dialog with her and therefore combat must begin immediately. Combat begins, she needs to wait for her turn to play this AD, at the end of which she will then turn into the slayer in gameplay.2) In dialog with her, players click the Attack button, and therefore ending the dialogue abruptly and starts the combat - which is then similar to scenario 1.
AD_CombatStart.how_to_trigger: They are 2 ways to trigger this dAD.1) Attack Orin before she spots you.2) Click the Dialog Attack button while in dialog with her.Different nodes is for when the players have a DU present during the initialition of this combat, or if the DU is somehow out of the temple.

Orin.synopsis: Orin, Chosen of Bhaal resides in Bhaal Temple, waiting for the players to arrive. She has given them an ultimatum to kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone for her, or the player's abducted companion will be sacrified.  If the players didn't have a valid companion for kidnapping, Yenna will take the place of sacrifice.Depending on the approach the player took to the altar, they may be in a slightly different position relative to the altar. Orin will teleport into the same spot on the alter in order to begin the dialogue.Regardless of the player's actions within the temple, and regardless of Gortash's fate, Orin will eventually begin a fight with the players. Determined to prove to Bhaal and herself that she is a worthy Chosen of Bhaal.She will transform into the slayer in the final moments of the dialogue, and then combat begins.
Orin.how_to_trigger: 1) With the debugbook, go to Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> Bhaal Temple Bridge.2) oe BTSetKilledGortash for Gortash killed3) oe BTUnholyAssassin for Unholy Assassin title.4) oe BTSetKilledSarevok for Sarevok killed.5) oe BTSetWarnedOrin for Orin was warned. If you set this, as you approach Orin, she will kill the victim first before you can talk to her. (Another dialog file)6) Go into the Bhaal Temple and trigger conversation with Orin.

InWorldAbduction_Yenna.synopsis: In certain areas in the Undercity, Orin will abduct and impersonate a target companion. Choice of target is the same as the camp abduction, but method and impersonation is not tied to the camp.
InWorldAbduction_Yenna.how_to_trigger:
To trigger the In-World Abductions1) 
CTRL+SHIFT+9 (Debug book) Go to Region -> Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> In-World Abdcution 1.
2) CTRL+SHIFT+8 (Camp debug book) - Invite Individual -> Yenna
3) Walk forward a bit down the stairs and you should trigger the event. Orin-as-Yenna will run towards you and start the dialog.4) If you want to try the other abduction location, you'll need to reload and use debug book to go to the other 3 locations.

Cultist_06.synopsis: A Bhaal Cultist in the Temple of Bhaal.

InWorldAbduction_Gale_10.text: Is that... is that truly you...? I thought I might never see you again.

InWorldAbduction_Gale_0.text: No... you need to leave. Put as much distance as you can between yourself and that monster.
InWorldAbduction_Gale_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale glances back towards where he came from, before turning back to  the player.NodeContext: hushed dread on 'no', glancing over his shoulder

InWorldAbduction_Gale_21.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Gale_21.text: Hold on. What are you doing down here?

InWorldAbduction_Gale_1.text: Orin. She snatched me up, from our camp. Brought me down here to her temple. A Bhaalist enclave.

InWorldAbduction_Gale_15.text: How long has it been? A tenday? Longer? I can't even tell... She did things to me... such awful things. Even I don't have the words. She... she took things from me...
InWorldAbduction_Gale_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: At the end of the line, Gale glances down briefly - hint that he's been castrated

InWorldAbduction_Gale_24.text: She let me run. She likes the sport of it... told me I could earn back what she cut off. My trophy, she said, if I could outpace her...

InWorldAbduction_Gale_13.text: Look, you can't fight her. She's too strong. Turn around. I'm done running. I'll buy you what time I can.
InWorldAbduction_Gale_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Another giggle. This one louder. Closer. (Orin) Gale readies himself for a fight, clearly not in good shape to take on anyone, never mind Orin.

InWorldAbduction_Gale_6.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Gale_6.text: All right. We'll turn back and figure out a way to deal with her. Thank you.

InWorldAbduction_Gale_23.text: That's it? You'd leave him, filleted and afraid, to fend for himself? So cold. So cruel.
InWorldAbduction_Gale_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's terror and anguish suddenly slips away, replaced with a cruel sneer.NodeContext: Sudden shift from terror and anguish to taunting cruelty

InWorldAbduction_Gale_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale long transforms into Orin

InWorldAbduction_Gale_7.text: That's not for you to decide.
InWorldAbduction_Gale_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's terror and anguish suddenly slips away, replaced with a cruel sneer.NodeContext: Sudden shift from terror to knowing cruelty - Orin is about to reveal herself

InWorldAbduction_Gale_12.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Gale_12.text: You will not stand alone. We face her together.

InWorldAbduction_Gale_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's terror and anguish suddenly slips away, replaced with a cruel sneer.NodeContext: Sudden shift from terror and anguish to taunting cruelty

InWorldAbduction_Gale_14.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Gale_14.text: Gale, what exactly did she cut off?

InWorldAbduction_Gale_8.text: Oh, something you're undoubtedly familiar with.
InWorldAbduction_Gale_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's terror and anguish suddenly slips away, replaced with a cruel sneer.NodeContext: Sudden shift from terror and anguish to taunting cruelty

InWorldAbduction_Gale_9.text: A few choice cuts and sweetmeats. Nothing fatal - not with my knife-work - but perhaps a tad... diminishing.
InWorldAbduction_Gale_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's terror and anguish suddenly slips away, replaced with a cruel sneer.NodeContext: Sudden shift from terror and anguish to taunting cruelty

InWorldAbduction_Gale_16.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Gale_16.text: Whatever you're running from, it holds no threat for me.

InWorldAbduction_Gale_4.text: You wouldn't say that. Not if you'd suffered a fraction of what was done to me. By Orin's hand.

InWorldAbduction_Gale_26.text: She snatched me up, from our camp. Brought me down here to her temple. A Bhaalist enclave.

PostLaezelAbduction_PAD_DeadYenna_0.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_PAD_DeadYenna_0.text: Ah, Yenna. Poor child deserved better.

Cultist_05_0.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Glyria
Cultist_05_0.text: They say you will fight her... Lady Orin. Will... will you shatter her skull? Break her bone...? Break...
Cultist_05_0.context: NodeContext: trails off into incoherent muttering at end

Cultist_05_1.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Glyria
Cultist_05_1.text: So many since... so much blood... never as satisfying... never like the first...

Cultist_05_2.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Glyria
Cultist_05_2.text: She is crushed... destroyed... obliterated... but her skull did not sit in my palm... not by my hand... no... no...
Cultist_05_2.context: NodeContext: Talking to himself, incoherent (essentially he's realised that Orin is dead and can't work out if he's responsible)

Cultist_05_4.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Glyria
Cultist_05_4.text: Break the bone... Feel it... the crunch and tear... Yes...
Cultist_05_4.context: NodeContext: Lost in the memory of a particularly satisfying murder he committed.

Cultist_05_5.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Glyria
Cultist_05_5.text: All darkness and anger... gripping the skull and hammer, hammer, hammer...
Cultist_05_5.context: NodeContext: Lost in the memory of a particularly satisfying murder he committed. Physical emphasis on hammer, as though he's reliving smashing someone's head into a wall

Cultist_05_3.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Glyria
Cultist_05_3.text: Gore on the wall... pulp on the hands... head all gone... yes, yes, I killed him. I killed them all.
Cultist_05_3.context: NodeContext: Lost in the memory of a particularly satisfying murder he committed.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_97.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_97.text: Look at it, crawling and sniffing and rooting around in the filth. Is it my Netherstone you seek, little piggy?
InWorldAbduction_Nested_97.context: NodeContext: Just transformed/revealed herself. Mocking the player.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_175.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_175.text: Hush, hush. Orin will take care of you. And your little pet.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_175.context: NodeContext: Smug, feels she has the advantage. Not yet confirmed she's abducted the companion.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_116.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_116.text: Murdering a child. What a wretched creature you are.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_31.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_31.text: Snatching a child? Killing a defenceless animal? You're a wretched creature.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_211.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_211.text: What have you done with Gale?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_24.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_24.text: What have you done with Halsin?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_12.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_12.text: What have you done with Lae'zel?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_86.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_86.text: What have you done with Minthara?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_5.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_5.text: What have you done with Yenna?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_145.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_145.text: Nothing, no not a thing! Still gasping and gagging on the foul airs of Bhaal's temple.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_145.context: NodeContext: Feigning defensivenes/outrage - wanted you to think he's dead

InWorldAbduction_Nested_137.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_137.text: You're welcome to him. I'll get some peace and quiet at last.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_202.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_202.text: Yes, yes it would be easy to snap his flapping jaw. Cut out his mouth meat and mute him for good. But not yet.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_202.context: NodeContext: Like this is a funny idea, flash of violence but she puts the thought aside

InWorldAbduction_Nested_182.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_182.text: Keep him. He can bore you with his prattling instead.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_43.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_43.text: She's all yours. I never trusted her anyway.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_127.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_127.text: Yes, yes such violence to be found in that one. Her blood boils hot and bitter, longing for release. But not yet.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_127.context: NodeContext: Savouring the thought of killng the abductee, but puts the thought aside

InWorldAbduction_Nested_102.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_102.text: She was a liability. You've done me a favour.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_199.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_199.text: You'd let me have her? She will make such tender meat for the slab. But not yet.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_199.context: NodeContext: Savouring the thought of killng the abductee, but puts the thought aside

InWorldAbduction_Nested_178.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_178.text: Gortash warned me you'd try something like this.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_170.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_170.text: Gortash. The Little Lord of Darkness. I know him well, yes yes and he knows me. Knows how my blades sculpt and carve this city.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_170.context: NodeContext: Hates Gortash, asserting her own power in relation to his

InWorldAbduction_Nested_53.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_53.text: I could peel a fine pelt from the mutt I caught sniffing at your heels. Drag skin from flesh from bone -
InWorldAbduction_Nested_53.context: NodeContext: Continuing idea from previous line 'my blade sculpts and carves' - this is what her blade is capable of. Getting carried away with the idea, then about to pull herself back on the next line

InWorldAbduction_Nested_74.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_74.text: I will not slice - his kind die too easily.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_74.context: NodeContext: Bored by the thought, she has much more exciting things planned

InWorldAbduction_Nested_83.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_83.text: The Murder Lord demands a better offering. A child of Bhaal. One whose veins pump with his poison.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_83.context: NodeContext: 'child of Bhaal' referring to her nemesis, the Dark Urge, 'Murder Lord" = Bhaal. thinks you're holding out on her.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_89.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_89.text: I know my slaughter kin is near. So does our Father. He wants to see us duel, to taste how we shred each other on his unholy soil.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_89.context: NodeContext: Thinks you're holding out on her, Second sentence is key information - the terms of her ultimatum. Savouring the thought of killing the Dark Urge

InWorldAbduction_Nested_125.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_125.text: But not yet, not until my kin proves worthy. The tyrant Gortash must be slaughtered. His Netherstone must be taken.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_125.context: NodeContext: Key information - the terms of her ultimatum

InWorldAbduction_Nested_6.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_6.text: The Murder Lord demands a better offering. Something new, sticky sweet and delicious. He wants you.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_6.context: NodeContext: 'Murder Lord' = Bhaal. Savouring the thought.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_185.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_185.text: The Murder Lord wants me? Why?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_139.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_139.text: Ketheric's killer. Turned the corpse-lover to carrion when you took his stone.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_139.context: NodeContext: Referring back to the player killing Ketheric, one of Orin's co-conspirators. Amused by the fact you killed him. 'stone' refers to the netherstones Orin asks you to bring to her - important.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_25.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_25.text: But he was a dull kill. No blood to spill, no guts to rip - a desiccated husk, all dust and hollow.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_138.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_138.text: You must be sharpened before you set your edge against my skin.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_155.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_155.text: Against the tyrant's throat, of course.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_155.context: NodeContext: About to transform into Gortash, getting to her point

InWorldAbduction_Nested_114.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_114.text: Enough of these riddles. Speak plainly.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_58.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_58.text: You'd prefer my whispers in the tyrant's tongue?
InWorldAbduction_Nested_58.context: NodeContext: About to transform into Gortash, getting to her point

InWorldAbduction_Nested_99.text: I had an arrangement with Lord Gortash. But he whinges and wails over the Crown, wanting to command it alone.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin transforms into Gortash. She holds out a hand, inspects it, suppressing the distaste she feels even assuming his form.NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin

InWorldAbduction_Nested_190.text: Oh how I long to slit his poxy smile from ear to ear. But I can't touch him. He bound my blade when we first conspired.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_190.context: NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin

InWorldAbduction_Nested_106.text: Gortash didn't want me at first. Didn't trust me. Got me to wag my tongue, swear an oath never to hang him from the hooks, drip-drain him into Father's open jaws...
InWorldAbduction_Nested_106.context: NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin. Losing herself in daydreams about killing him.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_35.text: You must kill the tyrant. Take the Netherstone from his corpse, and bring it to my temple.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_35.context: NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin - urgent

InWorldAbduction_Nested_122.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_122.text: There we slice and shred each other. The survivor claims the stones. What's left of the other is Bhaal's.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin reverts to her own formNodeContext: A glorious vision, Orin's idea of ecstasy. Mission explanation for the player.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_206.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_206.text: Agree, and I will bring my assassins to heel. They watch you always, longing to spray the crimson from your veins.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_206.context: NodeContext: with a leering threatening delight

InWorldAbduction_Nested_140.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_140.text: Refuse me, and you'll learn what happens to those who defy Bhaal's doctrine. So will your friend.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_140.context: NodeContext: as if wagging a finger to a naughty child (but actually threatening). 'your friend' refers to whoever she abducted from you

InWorldAbduction_Nested_128.speaker: Narrator
InWorldAbduction_Nested_128.text: *Orin demands a fight to the death. The prize for the victor - the Netherstones, and the chance to control the crown alone.*

InWorldAbduction_Nested_209.speaker: Narrator
InWorldAbduction_Nested_209.text: *Accept, and you must kill Gortash. Refuse, and the child's life may be forfeit. As might your own - Orin's assassins will hunt you like prey for slaughter.*

InWorldAbduction_Nested_107.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_107.text: I have an alliance with Gortash. I will not break it.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_124.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_124.text: The tyrant has you all twisted into knots, tight and tangled. Do you forget I have your meat strung on my hooks?
InWorldAbduction_Nested_124.context: NodeContext: Pissed off that Gortash got to you first. 'Tyrant' is Gortash, 'meat on hooks' refers to the companion she abducted

InWorldAbduction_Nested_10.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_10.text: So you're stabbing your ally in the back? Or rather, asking me to.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_64.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_64.text: Allies? No no. We had a balance, the Chosen three, but it tumbled when you turned the Bone Lord to ash. Now Gortash tries to gouge me from the city.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_64.context: NodeContext: Never intended to be loyal to them, amused at how it's all fallen apart. Hates to even say Gortash's name.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_57.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_57.text: That festering inadequate. Thinks me a flesher, butchering and cleaving only to whip the herd towards his tin men's oppression.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_57.context: NodeContext: Angry/outraged - setting off all her insecurities

InWorldAbduction_Nested_63.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_63.text: You must kill him. Gore him like a pig prepped for the spit. Only then you will be sweet and sharp, ready for the Murder Lord's purpose.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_63.context: NodeContext: 'gore' is a play on the name Gortash - doesn't need heavy emphasis. A more vicious statement of the player's mission.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_129.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_129.text: Sounds like you can't defeat Gortash without me. You need me.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_157.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_157.text: Need? Nonono, I do not need. You are made of nothing, meaningless flesh and bone. I do not need. I offer.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_157.context: NodeContext: Distancing herself from the player, establishing her power

InWorldAbduction_Nested_174.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_174.text: Bhaal's age approaches, and you could be there to see it. An idol of flesh, made to welcome his bleeding dawn.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_174.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks shocked, raises an eyebrow - you think I'll agree to this?NodeContext: Lost in the vision, rapturous

InWorldAbduction_Nested_92.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_92.text: There is time for you yet. Time to save.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_92.context: NodeContext: Teasing/tormenting - enjoying every moment. About to tell you how you can save your companion

InWorldAbduction_Nested_49.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_49.text: Do not underestimate his Steel Watch. Seek their cradle in the Lower City and skewer their skull meat. Make them rust and blood. Then you can gore the lordling again and again and again -
InWorldAbduction_Nested_49.context: NodeContext: Key info - delivering quest to seek out the steel watch foundry. Feigning generosity. Getting carried away with the thought of stabbing Gortash repeatedly.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_59.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_59.context: NodeContext: About to deliver her ultimatum/threat, as though it's a secret

InWorldAbduction_Nested_16.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_16.text: Step in my domain while the tyrant still sucks air, and I will carve your failure into your pretty plaything's skull.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_16.context: NodeContext: These are her terms - important for the player to understand. Almost whispered, maybe a hint of glee towards the end

InWorldAbduction_Nested_119.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_119.text: Bring me his stone, and I will set the bait free. Only then can the duel begin - my blood kin and I will create exquisite carnage. The victor will set the world to slaughter.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_119.context: NodeContext: These are her terms - important for the player to understand.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_80.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_80.text: Bring me his stone, and I will set the bait free. Only then can you and I make exquisite butchery. The victor will set the world to slaughter.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_80.context: NodeContext: These are her terms - important for the player to understand. Believes she'll be the victor.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_14.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_14.text: That is Bhaal's offer. He will not make another.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin disappears into the shadows.NodeContext: Final line - will disappear immediately after delivering it. True sense of Orin's threat here.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_88.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_88.text: I'll kill Gortash with pleasure. Then I'm coming for you.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_50.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_50.text: The promise of slaughter. Of pain and humiliation and the sound of blood drip-dropping into the gutter.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_50.context: NodeContext: Amused/playful. Thrilled by the idea of the player killing Gortash, of him reduced to meat and blood - nothing.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_201.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_201.text: I swear this. You'll be the next one dead at my feet. Not Gortash.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_21.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_21.text: Your useless promise will drip wet and red from your ruptured jaw before I let you disobey Bhaal. My assassins will make sure of it.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_21.context: NodeContext: Impoartant info - her assassins will attack the player after this point. 'Promise' referring to alliance with Gortash

InWorldAbduction_Nested_142.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_142.text: The Murder Lord will not be denied. Neither will I.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_142.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappearsNodeContext: Final line - will disappear immediately after delivering it. True sense of Orin's threat here.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_9.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_9.text: Swear no harm will come to Gale, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_159.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_159.text: Yes, oh yes. Kill the Banite, and I will keep my blade unblooded.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_159.context: NodeContext: Agreeing not to harm abductee if player kills Gortash first. Making a fair deal.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_90.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_90.text: Swear no harm will come to Halsin, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_17.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_17.text: Swear no harm will come to Lae'zel, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_38.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_38.text: Swear no harm will come to Minthara, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_196.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_196.text: Swear no harm will come to Yenna, and I will kill Gortash. Then we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_28.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_28.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Gale lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_32.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_32.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Halsin lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_41.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_41.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Lae'zel lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_153.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_153.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Minthara lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_65.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_65.text: So be it. I will kill Gortash. Yenna lives. Then, we fight for the final Netherstone.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_195.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_195.text: Gortash can wait. I'm coming for you first, monster.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_171.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_171.text: Silly, silly little slaughter hound. My assassins will not let you. If you hunt me, then they hunt you.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_132.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_132.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Gale.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_22.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_22.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Halsin.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_81.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_81.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Lae'zel.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_8.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_8.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Yenna.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_1.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_1.text: I'll do it. Just please - don't hurt Minthara.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_11.speaker: Narrator
InWorldAbduction_Nested_11.text: *Accept, and you must kill Gortash. Refuse, and your companion's life may be forfeit. As might your own - Orin's assassins will hunt you like prey for slaughter.*

InWorldAbduction_Nested_100.text: You've heard Gortash's whispers - I see how your skull swarms with his promises. He whinges and wails over the Crown of Karsus, wanting to command it without me.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin transforms into Gortash. She inspects herself, suppressing the distaste she feels even assuming his form.NodeContext: Gortash, as impersonated by Orin

InWorldAbduction_Nested_176.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_176.text: I'm sharp enough already. I'll show you right now.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_66.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_66.text: No, no. Not here. Not now. The tyrant must fall first.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_66.context: NodeContext: About to transform into Gortash, getting to her point

InWorldAbduction_Nested_152.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_152.text: Come for me, and you'll meet your god soon enough.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_26.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_26.text: Silly little worm. My god is always with me. He shudders to see how my blades plunge into soft surrendered flesh.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_78.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_78.text: Gortash's tyrant blood has cured your hide. You are almost fit for Bhaal's blade at last.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_78.context: NodeContext: "You are ready" - like the player has no choice in this

InWorldAbduction_Nested_62.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_62.text: We will be waiting for you, Chosen-killer.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappearsNodeContext: Final line of flow - impactful. 'We' refers to abducted companion + Orin herself.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_167.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_167.text: But it cannot be here. He must witness my domination. He must taste it. It must be in his Temple.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_167.context: NodeContext: Key info - delivering her ultimatum.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_130.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_130.text: Find me there. We will soak his soil with suffering. One claims the Netherstones, and one turns meat for the slab.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_130.context: NodeContext: Key info - delivering her ultimatum.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_113.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_113.text: That's no god you hear. It's your own twisted imagination.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_205.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_205.text: No, no, I am Bhaal's Chosen. He shows me glorious visions. Your flesh cleaved, your joints popped and broken. An altar slick with your sacrifice.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_205.context: NodeContext: dreaming, in awe of these wonderful visions from Bhaal

InWorldAbduction_Nested_95.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_95.text: But the dream... it flickers, I cannot focus on it. It is not yet complete. You must be made perfect. You must be sharpened.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_95.context: NodeContext: explaining something frustrating, then realising the solution

InWorldAbduction_Nested_184.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_184.text: So does everybody else. I'm afraid he'll have to wait his turn.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_29.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_29.text: The Murder Lord does not need permission to kill.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_3.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_3.text: You are dull, a blunt blade unfit to flay. But you could be sharpened, thin and jagged... Yes - I will tell you what to do.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_3.context: NodeContext: Fighting temptation to kill you where you stand. Building anticipation for the explanation she's about to give.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_51.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_51.text: I will not slice - her kind die too easily.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_51.context: NodeContext: Bored by the thought, she has much more exciting things planned

InWorldAbduction_Nested_82.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_82.text: Do you drown in despair already? But there's so much more to do.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_123.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_123.text: So eager to feel me drain its life away. Dull wits, dull blade. You are not yet ready.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_123.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player draws their weapon/adopts a combat ready stance.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_144.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aligns with the first node in each of the in-world abduction scenes. For example node N3 (UUID 71895db5-2701-4800-9bf3-14b2b3127dee) in LOW_BhaalTemple_InWorldAbduction_Gale. NodeContext: Orin giggles as she chases her 'victim'. It's a cruel, childish laugh - a predator playing with her food. The victim is actually Orin herself, so she's throwing her voice to make it sound like she's giving chase. Overall effect should be unsettling.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_149.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_149.text: Look at it, Father's favourite all lost and wandering. Have you forgotten the way home?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_150.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_150.text: You keep such silly little lambs in your flock. So easily slaughtered. Not like your green-gored friend. She loves the taste of blood too much.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_150.context: NodeContext: Referring to the fact Orin-as-Lae'zel just murdered a child in front of the player. Then toying with the player, revealing she has taken Lae'zel too

InWorldAbduction_Nested_46.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_46.text: Or did the child's little pet leave you no appetite for the main course? Do you not savour the slaughter of such innocence?
InWorldAbduction_Nested_46.context: NodeContext: Referring to the fact Orin just convinced the player to unwittingly eat Yenna's cat, then toying with them - revealing she has taken Yenna

InWorldAbduction_Nested_213.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_213.text: Should I set your lapdog to screaming? That could help you find the way.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_213.context: NodeContext: Mocking. 'Lapdog' refers to abducted companion

InWorldAbduction_Nested_91.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_91.text: So Gortash spoke the truth. You've been following me.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_204.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_204.text: The little lordling has been whispering in your ears? He always knew how to tumble and twist your mind matter, leave you knotted in his cords.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_204.context: NodeContext: feigning surprise, mocking. Referring to player character's previous allegiance with Gortash

InWorldAbduction_Nested_186.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_186.text: No matter. He is gored now. All maggot meal and bone-broken by your humbled butchery.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_186.context: NodeContext: Gleeful at the thought of Gortash dead, but still can't resist criticising the player's killing of him

InWorldAbduction_Nested_121.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_121.text: Better to be dull and brittle? A mind-mangled beast, no talent, no beauty in your atrocities.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_121.context: NodeContext: Scoffing. Thinks the player is 'dull and brittle'. Second sentence is Orin's opinion of the player, not a continuation of the question

InWorldAbduction_Nested_160.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_160.text: A blunt blade like you is not fit to carve Bhaal's glory. Thick-headed and foolish, to let the Banite's airs corrupt you.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_160.context: NodeContext: Vicious, bitter - tapping into her deep loathing/jealousy of the player

InWorldAbduction_Nested_192.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_192.text: What have you done with Gale?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_166.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_166.text: What have you done with Halsin?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_126.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_126.text: I will save him for you. We can peel his corpse together, once the Banite is dead.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_126.context: NodeContext: Mocking, as thought you're good friends. 'Baneite' is Gortash.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_179.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_179.text: Gortash betrays us, blood kin. He sets a leash to our slaughter, uses us to drive the herd towards his tin men's oppression.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_179.context: NodeContext: General angry tone at the current state of affairs. Slightly reluctant to confess this to the player.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_27.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_27.text: What have you done with Lae'zel?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_23.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_23.text: What have you done with Minthara?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_193.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_193.text: I will save her for you. We can peel her corpse together, once the Banite is dead.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_193.context: NodeContext: Mocking, as thought you're good friends. 'Baneite' is Gortash.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_146.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_146.text: What have you done with Yenna?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_200.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_200.text: Kidnapping? Amateur. I'd have killed him already.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_115.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_115.text: Kidnapping? Amateur. I'd have killed her already.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_84.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_84.text: Bhaal's blood-addled beloved, swaddled in sinews, thinks it can judge?
InWorldAbduction_Nested_84.context: NodeContext: Spitting, jealous - player immediately provoked her insecurities.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_20.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_20.text: Never struggled, no purpose, nannied by that grim-gotten Butler. You are the one who isn't capable.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_20.context: NodeContext: Spitting, jealous - player immediately provoked her insecurities. Reigning it in by the end (for transition to next node)

InWorldAbduction_Nested_143.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_143.text: You must kill the tyrant, smear him across his rock-rotten halls, and pluck the Netherstone from his carcass.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_143.context: NodeContext: Key info - player's mission. All in reference to killing Gortash

InWorldAbduction_Nested_180.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_180.text: Then we duel, sweet slaughter-kin. The winner claims the stones - Bhaal's true Chosen. The loser rots on his altar.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_180.context: NodeContext: Key info - Orin's demand of the Dark Urge (key to the player's arc). The way Orin will get what she craves (becoming Bhaal's true chosen)

InWorldAbduction_Nested_77.speaker: Narrator
InWorldAbduction_Nested_77.text: *So, this was Orin's intention. A combat against a fellow scion of Bhaal, witnessed by the Lord of Murder himself.*

InWorldAbduction_Nested_96.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_96.text: Bhaal made me his Slayer. I will become his Chosen too.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_212.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_212.text: No no no. Filthy lies! He waits for me to carve domination into your ravaged skull. He will grind your meat in his jaws.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_212.context: NodeContext: Desperate to believe this herself

InWorldAbduction_Nested_133.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_133.text: Find me in Father's sanctum. We will set our cruelties against each other, and his true Chosen will rise.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappearsNodeContext: Urgent, commanding. Last line before disappearing.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_134.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_134.text: Face the Tribunal. Then he will taste your submission.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears

InWorldAbduction_Nested_104.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_104.text: But first, first, you must make gutspill of the tyrant.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_104.context: NodeContext: Desperate, urgent - needs this more than anything

InWorldAbduction_Nested_173.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_173.text: I will not be Bhaal's Chosen. He cannot claim me.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_67.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_67.text: His blood cannot be denied, slaughter kin. Neither can I.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_67.context: NodeContext: Giggling - what a ridiculous thing to say

InWorldAbduction_Nested_172.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_172.text: My alliance with Gortash is restored. Give me your stone, and I'll let you live.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_117.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_117.text: Is your brain so pulped? You suck up the tyrant's vapours like a babe sucks milk.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_117.context: NodeContext: Disbelief - are you seriously that stupid?

InWorldAbduction_Nested_93.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_93.text: Once you've remembered your place, seek out the Steel Watch's cradle in the Lower City. Skewer their skull meat, make them rust and blood. Then the lordling will be yours to butcher.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_93.context: NodeContext: Important infortmation - giving a key step on the quest to kill Gortash, by destroying the steel watch foundry. Once they're gone, he'll be vulnerable

InWorldAbduction_Nested_135.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_135.text: Come to my temple before you turn Gortash to carrion, and I will ready your friend's corpse to greet you.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_135.context: NodeContext: Key info for player - if they do not do as Orin says, she will kill their companion

InWorldAbduction_Nested_162.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_162.text: Bhaal is waiting, slaughter kin. Do not disappoint him.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappearsNodeContext: Smug, enjoying her power in the situation. Last line before disappearing.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_37.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_37.text: Kill Gortash yourself, if you think you're truly Bhaal's Chosen.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_136.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_136.text: That festering inadequate bound my blades when we first conspired. His crimson is not mine to spill. It must be you.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_136.context: NodeContext: Key info - Orin is bound by her pact with Gortash, preventing her from harming him. She's really pissed about this - it puts her at a disadvantage

InWorldAbduction_Nested_203.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_203.text: Why wait? Let's kill each other right now.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_118.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_118.text: You forget how Father's blood clots our veins. It must be returned to him, seeped straight into his grimborn jaws.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_141.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_141.text: A duel it is. I will extinguish Gortash. Then I will come for you.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_85.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_85.text: A duel it is. I am coming for you, Orin.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_55.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_55.text: I witnessed your slipshod butchery. How you mauled the tyrant Gortash, turned him carcass for the crows. You are ready.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_55.context: NodeContext: Mocking the player's method of killing Gortash. Judging you, but reluctantly confirming the importance of your actions.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_71.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_71.text: Bhaal calls to us, his children. He would see us gouge and gut each other at last. A duel, our blood shed on his unholy soil.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_177.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_177.text: But first, first you must be cleansed, bathed in the Murder Lord's sight. You must face his tribunal. Seek Grandfather's blessing.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_177.context: NodeContext: Key info - instructing the player for the next part of their quest, to go to the murder tribunal.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_103.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_103.text: Only then will you be permitted to return. Refuse, and I will slick Bhaal's sanctum with your plaything's sacrifice instead.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_103.context: NodeContext: Key info - if you don't  obey her command, she will kill your companion

InWorldAbduction_Nested_108.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_108.text: A shame. I was looking forward to killing him myself.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_110.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_110.text: Do not fear, slaughter kin. I will not set my blades to shredding yet.
InWorldAbduction_Nested_110.context: NodeContext: Pretending to be on the same page as the player

InWorldAbduction_Nested_151.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_151.text: A shame. I was looking forward to killing her myself.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_47.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_47.text: Murdering a child. What a wretched creature you are.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_148.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Nested_148.text: Snatching a child? Killing a defenceless animal? You're a wretched creature.

InWorldAbduction_Nested_191.speaker: Orin
InWorldAbduction_Nested_191.text: Look at it, brain battered and broken, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. Have you forgotten the way home, sibling?
InWorldAbduction_Nested_191.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

Reaper_03_0.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Ogga
Reaper_03_0.text: And thus, Bhaal's bloody favour passes to another. Congratulations.
Reaper_03_0.context: NodeContext: Commanding, someone who holds authority (even though the player outranks them)

Reaper_03_1.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Ogga
Reaper_03_1.text: Speak not with me - it is Lady Orin who seeks your presence.

Reaper_03_2.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Ogga
Reaper_03_2.text: Did you not feel his presence? You cannot shirk the weight of your lineage, Bhaalspawn, not really. It is far too heavy.
Reaper_03_2.context: NodeContext: Commanding, someone who holds authority (even though the player outranks them)

Reaper_03_3.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Ogga
Reaper_03_3.text: You cannot possibly comprehend what happened here today. Just be grateful you hold the Chosen's favour.
Reaper_03_3.context: NodeContext: sneering, they are above the player

Reaper_03_4.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Ogga
Reaper_03_4.text: You cannot possibly comprehend what happened here today. Near apotheosis - cast aside. How wasteful.
Reaper_03_4.context: NodeContext: sneering, they are above the player

Reaper_03_5.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Ogga
Reaper_03_5.text: Lady Orin misjudged the weight of Bhaal's favour. So have you, spawn of Murder.
Reaper_03_5.context: NodeContext: a veiled threat as advice

Reaper_03_6.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Ogga
Reaper_03_6.text: Lady Orin misjudged the weight of Bhaal's favour. She slipped, and it crushed her. Tread carefully, Chosen.
Reaper_03_6.context: NodeContext: a veiled threat as advice

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_78.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_78.text: Do not look, Boo. It is no longer our friend who stands there.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_78.context: NodeContext: Genuinely broken-hearted that we accepted Bhaal (leaves with Jaheira, to ambush us outside)

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_36.text: All is nothing to me, beside Father.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_29.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_29.text: Drop that stone. You will want your hands free for what comes next.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding Nether stone/Dagger prop from Orin

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_12.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_12.text: Out of my way! You look upon a god.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_3.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_3.text: Boo knows many gods. You don't look like any of them.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_59.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_59.text: This stone gives control over the Absolute. It must be mine.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_82.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_82.text: Without you, there would be no Absolute. This was all your doing.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_74.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_74.text: And Minsc shall be your undoing!

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_62.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_62.text: Let's not fight, I didn't want any of this.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_93.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_93.text: You can lie to Minsc. Perhaps even to Jaheira. But not to Boo.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_93.context: NodeContext: Sadly - he'll fight us to the death but he didn't want it to come to this

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_32.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_32.text: You have what you wanted, Chosen. And now you will see exactly what that means.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_52.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_52.text: Bhaal was going to kill me if I didn't accept!

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_13.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_13.text: And you could have embraced death with a smile. Few are given such a choice.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_7.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_7.text: You don't understand. I'm not an evil person.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_70.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_70.text: Boo and I - we once hoped that that was true. But no longer.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_119.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_119.text: Who is this performance for, Bhaalspawn? It is only us here - you need not pretend.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_53.text: I don't want you to die. I want you to serve.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_117.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_117.text: Then I am afraid you don't know us at all - as we never truly knew you.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_56.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_56.text: *You feel a tug of recognition - Minsc's unwitting mind, mingled tides of anger, grief, confusion. Friends and enemies, melding beyond recognition.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_81.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_81.text: Ease his confusion. Try to control him.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_89.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_89.text: *A simple command. Your tadpole provides the means, your bloodline the message: to end these petty mortals who plague your Father.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_21.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_21.text: No more threats? I admit, I was hoping for -

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: A rasp of steel, and Jaheira stops short with a wet gasp - then falls forward, revealing Minsc holding his bloodied sword. The mind-meld dissipates, and he looks at her body with growing horror. Then to us, rage and grief building.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_94.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_94.text: What did I - ? What did you make Minsc do?!

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_72.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_72.text: You have won Bhaal's bloody blessing. Now you think you will step out into the world, and carve your name upon it.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_114.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_114.text: Minsc and I, we know better. We stood here a century ago, and watched this same ceremony unfold. We stand here again to show you how it ends:

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_69.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_69.text: I know better. I stood here a century ago, and watched this same ceremony unfold. I stand here again to show you how it ends:

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_4.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_4.text: With your bones rotting beneath your father's hall - your name remembered by none.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_76.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_76.text: You really think you can kill me? ME? The Slayer-King!

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_16.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_16.text: We have slain kings. And gods. And one time, a giant. But never before a friend.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_8.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_8.text: Cowards! You waited until I did all the dirty work.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_14.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_14.text: Jaheira hoped there was still some flimsy light of good within you, small as Boo but just as bright.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_86.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_86.text: What about you? Will you protect the world from what they have become?

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_61.speaker: Astarion
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_61.text: I really hoped we could avoid being pawns for a dark god, but here we are, I suppose.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_67.speaker: Astarion
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_67.text: I'm with you, my dear. Wherever this leads.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_34.speaker: Wyll
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_34.text: I thought I'd saved you from Bhaal's clutches. Seems I failed, damn it all.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_77.speaker: Wyll
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_77.text: I will mourn the person you were. But I will not accept the one you've become.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_18.speaker: Gale
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_18.text: I tried once before... but it seems Bhaal has too tight a grasp on you.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_45.speaker: Gale
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_45.text: Still though, I won't leave. There's a good person in there somewhere.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_30.speaker: Gale
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_30.text: There is nothing more to be said, but a final goodbye.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_50.speaker: Karlach
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_50.text: I tried to save you - when Bhaal came for you before, I stood by you.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_49.speaker: Karlach
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_49.text: And I stand beside you now. I know you. You're more than this. More than Bhaal. You're my friend, and I won't leave you.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_60.speaker: Karlach
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_60.text: But... but this? I can't pardon this. I can't fix this. This is it. It's over.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_107.speaker: Lae'zel
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_107.text: I tried to save you from the Lord of Murder - and still you gave in.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_90.speaker: Lae'zel
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_90.text: Damn you. I cannot turn my back. I will not.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_48.speaker: Shadowheart
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_48.text: I tried to wrest you from Bhaal's grip once already. Seems I failed.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_22.speaker: Shadowheart
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_22.text: But I won't give up on you - not just yet. I'm my own worst enemy in that regard.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_105.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_105.text: Goodbye, Bhaalspawn. Harpers, to arms. Let's defend this city as we always have.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_26.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_26.text: Boo and Minsc promise to make it swift, evil.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_37.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_37.text: Jaheira... must it truly be this way?
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_37.context: NodeContext: Minsc almost sobbing, he is very erluctant

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_106.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_106.text: This path was not of our choosing, Minsc. But we must walk it all the same.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_106.context: NodeContext: Gentle, but resolute - Minsc doesn't want to kill us and Jaheira understands, but she knows we're too far gone

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_6.text: None shall stand in my way.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_46.text: Bhaal below, I thought I got rid of you.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_104.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_104.text: Only a respite. Do not forget who knows the Bhaalspawn better than any alive. Your path only ever led one way.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_113.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_113.text: Boo and I - we prayed it would be Orin who prevailed. It would make the slaughter to come a little gentler.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_44.speaker: Captain Leafsong
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_44.text: Greetings, Bhaalspawn. I hoped to see the High Harper walk out those doors with you.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_44.context: NodeContext: Grim formality. He's there as a backup plan of Jaheira's in case we went rabid - and the fact that she's not with us is proof enough she's dead, and he has to fight us.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_38.speaker: Captain Leafsong
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_38.text: But if she hasn't... well, we'll mourn her later. She gave us a job to do.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_38.context: NodeContext: Grim formality. He's there as a backup plan of Jaheira's in case we went rabid - and the fact that she's not with us is proof enough she's dead, and he has to fight us.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_51.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_51.context: NodeContext: Utter fury, all the worse because she's keeping it restrained.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_20.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_20.text: Live with it, if you can - I will not.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_20.context: NodeContext: Quiet, barely restrained disgust - leaves after.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_55.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_55.text: *The stone trembles with evils, warm as Father's hate.*
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding Nether stone/Dagger prop from Orin

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_40.speaker: Lae'zel
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_40.text: The Lord of Murder calls you. You know what your answer must be.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_28.speaker: Karlach
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_28.text: You can hear him, can't you? The Lord of Murder. You can hear, but you won't listen. I know you won't.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_116.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_116.text: Fall in line. We leave, now.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_84.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_84.text: Of course, I didn't mean a word I said to Bhaal.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_58.text: I shall use the stone well, I promise.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_64.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_64.text: *Unease fills the Bhaal Temple's stagnant air.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_88.text: We should all begin to pray.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_54.speaker: Wyll
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_54.text: Think carefully. Do not give yourself to the Dread Lord, no matter how strong your cravings.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_101.speaker: Shadowheart
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_101.text: Careful what you do with that thing...

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_103.speaker: Gale
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_103.text: He calls to you, doesn't he? Bhaal. Resist him - to rule in his name would be to lose who you truly are.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_111.speaker: Astarion
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_111.text: I really hope you know what you're doing.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_118.speaker: Halsin
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_118.text: Yours are not the hands in which I would have placed such terrible power. Think carefully on your next action, please.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_43.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_43.text: *Another part of your glimmering birthright, for you to abuse as you please.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_97.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_97.text: You've chosen the company you keep - I will not allow the Bhaalspawn to hide behind you.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_97.context: NodeContext: Grim, ready to kill us - not apologetic, but explaining that we've brought this on ourselves.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_75.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_75.text: Harpers - let us do what we must.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Acceptance_75.context: NodeContext: Authorative order to the Harpers she's gathered - to kill the party.

DeathsHead_01_0.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Grimlark
DeathsHead_01_0.text: To stand before the legacy of murder is an honour most profane. I treasure it.

DeathsHead_01_1.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Grimlark
DeathsHead_01_1.text: Lady Orin awaits you at the altar. Make haste.

DeathsHead_01_2.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Grimlark
DeathsHead_01_2.text: Bhaal rejoices in the Chosen's ascension. As do I, as should you.

DeathsHead_01_3.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Grimlark
DeathsHead_01_3.text: Lord... Lord Bhaal offered you everything... And... yet...
DeathsHead_01_3.context: NodeContext: quivering, confused, shocked - yout turned down a boon from his god

DeathsHead_01_4.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Grimlark
DeathsHead_01_4.text: To reject the Lord of Murder... Madness... Ungrateful...
DeathsHead_01_4.context: NodeContext: quivering, confused, shocked - yout turned down a boon from his god

DeathsHead_01_5.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Grimlark
DeathsHead_01_5.text: For an unfaithful such as you... to have beheld him... Unconscionable.
DeathsHead_01_5.context: NodeContext: quivering, confused, shocked - yout turned down a boon from his god

DeathsHead_01_6.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Grimlark
DeathsHead_01_6.text: Bhaal rejoices in your ascension, Chosen. As do I.

DeathsHead_01_7.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Grimlark
DeathsHead_01_7.text: Only Bhaal's faithful could've properly savoured a kill such as Lady Orin. What a waste.

Reaper_02_0.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Snirr
Reaper_02_0.text: Orin taught us some very specific cruelties. Speak the word, Chosen, and I will inflict them on anyone you wish.
Reaper_02_0.context: NodeContext: Commanding, someone who holds authority (even though the player outranks them)

Reaper_02_1.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Snirr
Reaper_02_1.text: Orin taught us some very specific cruelties. Betray the Chosen's trust, and I will inflict them upon you without hesitation.
Reaper_02_1.context: NodeContext: Commanding, someone who holds authority (even though the player outranks them)

Reaper_02_2.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Snirr
Reaper_02_2.text: Orin taught us some very specific cruelties. Were you not Bhaal's spawn, I would inflict them upon you, traitor.
Reaper_02_2.context: NodeContext: Commanding, someone who holds authority (even though the player outranks them)

Reaper_02_3.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Snirr
Reaper_02_3.text: Lady Orin has been waiting for you... We all have.

Reaper_02_4.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Snirr
Reaper_02_4.text: I am sure you have cruelties of your own to teach us, Bhaalspawn. For that... I cannot wait.
Reaper_02_4.context: NodeContext: bhaalspawn said with utter reverence

Reaper_02_5.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Snirr
Reaper_02_5.text: Step aside, bastard child. Another Chosen will fill your place soon enough.
Reaper_02_5.context: NodeContext: bhaalspawn said with utter reverence

Reaper_02_6.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Snirr
Reaper_02_6.text: To rebuke the Lord of Murder... You travel with a fool, a wastrel.
Reaper_02_6.context: NodeContext: Commanding, someone who holds authority (even though the player outranks them)

Cultist_04_0.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
Cultist_04_0.text: To let such a weakling leave unharmed... But it is Bhaal's decree. I will not defy him.
Cultist_04_0.context: NodeContext: Struggling not to murder you there and then, findhing resolve in obeying his god's commands

Cultist_04_1.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
