Cultist_04_1.text: Sarevok... Purged at last. I do not see why the Dread Lord kept such a fossil around so long.
Cultist_04_1.context: NodeContext: Thinks Sarevok was a fool

Cultist_04_2.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
Cultist_04_2.text: Orin has taught us much in your absence. I can't wait for you to see...
Cultist_04_2.context: NodeContext: Warning, trying to make you jealous

Cultist_04_3.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
Cultist_04_3.text: Come no closer. You live and breathe here by Bhaal's will, not mine.

Cultist_04_4.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
Cultist_04_4.text: The stone trembles at your presence. Bhaal is watching. So is Orin. We are waiting.

Cultist_04_5.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
Cultist_04_5.text: A brutal death - Orin deserved nothing less. May we all be so lucky.
Cultist_04_5.context: NodeContext: Approving without being impressed. This is just how it should be.

Cultist_04_6.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
Cultist_04_6.text: Only fools have ever lingered in my presence. Dead fools. Go.
Cultist_04_6.context: NodeContext: Threatening (toying with you - this doesn't lead to combat)

DeathsHead_02_AD_DarkUrgeDuel_0.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_AD_DarkUrgeDuel_0.text: They have spoiled the duel. Bhaal bays for their blood.

DeathsHead_02_AD_DarkUrgeDuel_2.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_AD_DarkUrgeDuel_2.text: Lord Bhaal demands a pure bloodsport. But if anyone interferes, we gut them.

Reaper_05_0.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Eglantine
Reaper_05_0.text: The blood on his profane hands... It could have been yours too. You could have been Chosen.
Reaper_05_0.context: NodeContext: Satisfied - things are finally going right

Reaper_05_1.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Eglantine
Reaper_05_1.text: All of Toril shall scream at your command... and we shall dance atop its dying whimpers.

Reaper_05_2.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Eglantine
Reaper_05_2.text: Bhaal will choose another, soon enough - one who will hunt down previous failures like your companion. I would start running.
Reaper_05_2.context: NodeContext: Satisfied - things are finally going right

Reaper_05_3.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Eglantine
Reaper_05_3.text: All of Toril could have screamed at your command... A shame.

Reaper_05_4.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Eglantine
Reaper_05_4.text: I can hear the screams already, Chosen. Murder reigns at last.
Reaper_05_4.context: NodeContext: Satisfied - things are finally going right

Reaper_05_5.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Eglantine
Reaper_05_5.text: If you care for anyone up above - tell them to start running. I like a chase.
Reaper_05_5.context: NodeContext: Satisfied - things are finally going right

Reaper_05_6.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Eglantine
Reaper_05_6.text: Lady Orin has long awaited your presence here... I have long awaited the sound of your screams.

UnholyAssassin_02_0.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_0.text: You are not fit to bear Bhaal's blood. Get out.

UnholyAssassin_02_1.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_1.text: Few mutilate with Orin's skill. Her craft is exquisite. It is a rare honour to see her work - relish it.

UnholyAssassin_02_3.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_3.text: So, the true Chosen rises. I taste the chaos on my tongue already.
UnholyAssassin_02_3.context: NodeContext: Approving, savouring the carnage to come

UnholyAssassin_02_4.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_4.text: Lady Orin gathering so many of Bhaal's butchers in one place... I can only imagine what she has in store for us.
UnholyAssassin_02_4.context: NodeContext: Impressed with Orin, despite himself

UnholyAssassin_02_5.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_5.text: So, you too passed Sarevok's tribunal.

UnholyAssassin_02_10.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_10.text: Killing him was an inspired choice. I wish I'd thought of that.

UnholyAssassin_02_2.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_2.text: Make sure your standards do not slip - we have a reputation to maintain.

UnholyAssassin_02_7.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_7.text: Such agonies I would inflict upon you for what you've done here. But Bhaal's law is absolute. You may leave, unmauled.

UnholyAssassin_02_8.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_8.text: Indeed... two paragons of murder, bent on the other's annihilation. What a fascinating prospect...
UnholyAssassin_02_8.context: NodeContext: Detached, doesn't really care if you live or not - thinking of the player's upcoming death duel as an academic exercise

UnholyAssassin_02_9.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_9.text: It has been a while since a fellow Unholy Assassin walked in the temple. I cannot wait to see you work.

UnholyAssassin_02_11.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_11.text: It is a pity you are already marked for Orin's blade - I would've relished pitting you against my own.

UnholyAssassin_02_6.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
UnholyAssassin_02_6.text: I will settle, however, for seeing the two of you clash. I imagine it will be... instructive.
UnholyAssassin_02_6.context: NodeContext: Somewhere between challenging and threatening

Cultist_03_0.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_0.context: NodeContext: Getting lost in the craving for flesh

Cultist_03_3.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_3.text: I wonder... How would your flesh feel slithering down my gullet? Succulent... Tender...

Cultist_03_1.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_1.text: Begone, before I set my teeth to your flesh.
Cultist_03_1.context: NodeContext: First instructing, then adding an edge of threat. A cannibal coming to eat you.

Cultist_03_4.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_4.text: Such temptation, but you are not mine to devour - that honour lies with Lady Orin alone. She insisted.

Cultist_03_5.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_5.text: You have returned... Do you remember? You were the one who first fed me flesh.
Cultist_03_5.context: NodeContext: Awestruck, reverent - can't quite believe it

Cultist_03_2.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_2.text: But Lady Orin does not let us feed as you did. Please... kill her, let us sate ourselves.
Cultist_03_2.context: NodeContext: Talking about cannibalism, as though meeting a hero

Cultist_03_6.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_6.text: She is gone, and we may feast. A shame you will not be joining us - I've just carved up a most succulent halfling.
Cultist_03_6.context: NodeContext: Wicked, thinking of the cruelties to come

Cultist_03_7.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_7.text: We've had such starveling rations since you left. Retake your throne, and we shall feast once more.

Cultist_03_8.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
Cultist_03_8.text: Bhaal's Chosen is here. We will never go hungry again.
Cultist_03_8.context: NodeContext: Wicked, thinking of the cruelties to come

NightBlade_01_0.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
NightBlade_01_0.text: Lord Bhaal... Disrespected by his Chosen... Unheard of...
NightBlade_01_0.context: NodeContext: Awed by the DU's presence

NightBlade_01_1.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
NightBlade_01_1.text: I could feel His hate... How it roiled for you, betrayer child.
NightBlade_01_1.context: NodeContext: just saw their god, in awe

NightBlade_01_2.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
NightBlade_01_2.text: How could you not accept our Lord's most profane succour? How? How?
NightBlade_01_2.context: NodeContext: lamenting, awstruck by a recently appeared god

NightBlade_01_3.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
NightBlade_01_3.text: Bhaal's Chosen... I am not worthy.
NightBlade_01_3.context: NodeContext: Awed by the DU's presence

NightBlade_01_4.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
NightBlade_01_4.text: Lord Bhaal spoke to the Chosen... I heard it myself...
NightBlade_01_4.context: NodeContext: Awed by the DU's presence

NightBlade_01_5.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
NightBlade_01_5.text: Seek an audience with Lady Orin at the altar. She has a... surprise for you. Heh.

NightBlade_01_6.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
NightBlade_01_6.text: I would lick the viscera from your boot, Bhaalspawn. It is all I deserve.
NightBlade_01_6.context: NodeContext: Awed by the DU's presence

Cultist_02_0.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_0.text: I'm rather hoping your skin remains intact. Until I slice it up for stitching, at least.
Cultist_02_0.context: NodeContext: As though this is reasonable

Cultist_02_3.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_3.text: I hear you are to duel Lady Orin... If it pleases you, Child of Murder, I would have her carcass once you are finished.

Cultist_02_2.speaker: Player
Cultist_02_2.text: How do you know I will win?

Cultist_02_9.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_9.text: Oh - I don't. I asked the same favour of Lady Orin.

Cultist_02_8.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_8.text: Either of your pelts would make a most... exquisite trophy. I'm sure you understand.

Cultist_02_4.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_4.text: Oh, nothing untoward. I simply wish to flay her.

Cultist_02_13.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_13.text: Oh, most generous of you... yes.

Cultist_02_1.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_1.text: But - but of course. I should not pester you with matters so mundane. Shame...

Cultist_02_5.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_5.text: Such skin she has... so fine and malleable. What a trophy it would make...
Cultist_02_5.context: NodeContext: trailing off in longing, imagining an exquisite material for his work

Cultist_02_7.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_7.text: Githyanki pelts must cure the same way as anyone else's. You're flesh and blood, after all...
Cultist_02_7.context: NodeContext: Creepy, fawning - he's sizing you up and deciding he would like to kill you for your skin - on the "

Cultist_02_10.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_10.text: Please, refrain from excessive violence when duelling with Lady Orin. Holes in the skin are very difficult to repair.

Cultist_02_11.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Velki
Cultist_02_11.text: That pretty skin of Orin's all melted to nothing. Unflayed. Untreated. What a waste.

AD_AdmiringKill_01_4.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
AD_AdmiringKill_01_4.text: You are well studied in Lady Orin's ways, I see.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_4.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_8.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_8.text: One cannot be a true Unholy Assassin without knowing their betters.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_8.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_7.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_7.text: And we've never seen a murderer quite like Lady Orin before. No one has.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_7.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_6.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_6.text: So, tell me. If this was your kill, how would you have done it?
AD_AdmiringKill_01_6.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_1.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
AD_AdmiringKill_01_1.text: I'd have ripped the spine out, and worn its carcass as a cowl.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_1.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_2.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_2.text: Inventive, but wasteful. What of the backbone - you would discard it?
AD_AdmiringKill_01_2.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_5.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
AD_AdmiringKill_01_5.text: Of course not. I'd save it for later - there's always use for a spine.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_5.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_13.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
AD_AdmiringKill_01_13.text: I believe Orin first made an incision in the upper left clavicle.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_13.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_10.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_10.text: I am afraid I must disagree. Orin's first cut was quite clearly the throat.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_10.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_16.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_16.text: But... would she not toy with the victim? Why begin with a death blow?
AD_AdmiringKill_01_16.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_11.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_11.text: A properly cut throat does not kill right away. It bleeds the victim.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_11.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_3.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
AD_AdmiringKill_01_3.text: Like a prize piglet, trussed up for the slaughter... Yes. You're quite right.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_3.context: NodeContext: almost a lustful description of murder

AD_AdmiringKill_01_14.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
AD_AdmiringKill_01_14.text: Tell me, then. If you were Orin, how would you have killed it?
AD_AdmiringKill_01_14.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_15.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_15.text: I would never dare to compare myself to Lady Orin.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_15.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_12.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_12.text: But if it were my kill... Well. It would've been slower.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_12.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_9.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
AD_AdmiringKill_01_9.text: You'd have poisoned your prey? Seems a bit... dull.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_9.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

AD_AdmiringKill_01_0.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
AD_AdmiringKill_01_0.text: Not if the poison made the skin leak blood and the eyes weep pus. Be creative.
AD_AdmiringKill_01_0.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

PostBattle_PAD_AbducteeKilled_0.speaker: Player
PostBattle_PAD_AbducteeKilled_0.text: An unnatural death. There's no coming back from that.
PostBattle_PAD_AbducteeKilled_0.context: NodeContext: [Astarion: bummed, but not REALLY willing to take responsibility for the killing.]

Reaper_04_0.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Hiila
Reaper_04_0.text: To challenge Lady Orin was bold... To slay her, even bolder. I look forward to your instruction, my liege.
Reaper_04_0.context: NodeContext: Smug, appeasing - can't be trusted

Reaper_04_1.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Hiila
Reaper_04_1.text: You... pet of the Chosen. Your master has been very bold, very bold indeed...
Reaper_04_1.context: NodeContext: sneering, thinks themselves above the player

Reaper_04_2.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Hiila
Reaper_04_2.text: Bhaal's will is clear - this world is ripe for the plucking. If you are not strong enough to lead us, another will.

Reaper_04_3.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Hiila
Reaper_04_3.text: You step on grounds unhallowed. Choose your path wisely - Lady Orin seeks an audience.

Reaper_04_4.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Hiila
Reaper_04_4.text: To challenge Lady Orin was bold... To slay her, even bolder. It is a shame you baulked in the face of godhood.
Reaper_04_4.context: NodeContext: Smug, appeasing - can't be trusted

Reaper_04_5.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Hiila
Reaper_04_5.text: You... pet of the Bhaalspawn. Your master refused a most delicious fate this day.
Reaper_04_5.context: NodeContext: sneering, thinks themselves above the player

Reaper_04_6.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Hiila
Reaper_04_6.text: This world is ripe to be plucked, Chosen... and mashed into a bloody pulp beneath your boot.

PostBattleDarkUrge_0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
PostBattleDarkUrge_0.text: Master. You are the chosen one.
PostBattleDarkUrge_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The butler appears, delighted at your victoryNodeContext: Awestruck

PostBattleDarkUrge_48.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
PostBattleDarkUrge_48.text: He is near... He comes for you.
PostBattleDarkUrge_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: The butler smiles, his body beginning to vibrate, and jerk strangely. The light in the room flickers, as an evil wind begins to blow. The party looks around, uncertain.NodeContext: Butler's body beginning to vibrate, and jerk strangely

PostBattleDarkUrge_86.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The butler levitates, held up in the air like a broken marionette on invisible strings. Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

PostBattleDarkUrge_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge walks toward the pool of blood, peering down at the Avatar of Bhaal within

PostBattleDarkUrge_7.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_7.text: But you live, and her blood is returned to me. You are my Chosen.

PostBattleDarkUrge_87.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_87.text: I have a gift for you, Child. You will use it to lacerate this world.
PostBattleDarkUrge_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: The avatar of Bhaal holds out his hand. The eyes glow on the symbol of Bhaal carved from the cave wall behind the avatar. The non-reflected symbol in front of the player mimics this behavior.

PostBattleDarkUrge_50.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_50.text: *A gift from your god, your Father. An offering of his affection for you, or confirmation that he owns you.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_51.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_51.text: *Accept Father's gift and you will reap horrors upon this world. But you will be his puppet. This is your final chance to cut your strings...*

PostBattleDarkUrge_43.text: What gift does the Lord of Murder propose?

PostBattleDarkUrge_6.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_6.text: My Slayer. You will grow stronger. Crueller. The prime incarnation of murder.

PostBattleDarkUrge_65.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_65.text: What would you have me do with this gift?

PostBattleDarkUrge_42.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_42.text: I have no desire to harm anyone else.

PostBattleDarkUrge_79.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: The light flickers in the room - Bhaal is getting annoyed.

PostBattleDarkUrge_81.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_81.text: I have no need of such a power.

PostBattleDarkUrge_38.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_38.text: No god gives selflessly. What do you ask in return?

PostBattleDarkUrge_88.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_88.text: Domination. Slaughter. Mountains of corpses, you standing atop them.

PostBattleDarkUrge_22.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_22.text: You must destroy this world. It is what you were made for.

PostBattleDarkUrge_13.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_13.text: *For a moment, the brine-pool of your brain clears. To die: to rest, to save the world from yourself. To accept: to become his prophet - in any disobedience, subject to his lash.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_19.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_19.text: I understand now. In your name, Father, it will be done.

PostBattleDarkUrge_1.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_1.text: Then there is no escaping my fate.

PostBattleDarkUrge_80.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_80.text: I've defied you before. You cannot force me to do this.

PostBattleDarkUrge_44.text: Every night you can possess me, my friends' lives are in danger. I will not stand for that.

PostBattleDarkUrge_60.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_60.text: You are my spawn. Your veins course with my unholy blood.

PostBattleDarkUrge_3.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_3.text: Your life is mine. Accept your inheritance, or I will reclaim it.

PostBattleDarkUrge_39.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_39.text: I don't have a choice, it seems. This is what I am.

PostBattleDarkUrge_5.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_5.text: My Chosen. My Slayer. Violence incarnate. You will become a testament in blood.
PostBattleDarkUrge_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The skull symbol's eyes brighter, bathing the room in ember red light. The player stumbles as though struck in the head, stricken with pain. The player opens their eyes slowly, they too are glowing in the same color as the skull's eyes.NodeContext: The slightest hint of approval/affection on the "My Chosen. My slayer."

PostBattleDarkUrge_26.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_26.text: Go, child of Bhaal. Claim the crown of Karsus, control the Absolute, and command a horde fit to butcher this world in my name.
PostBattleDarkUrge_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: All light is extinguished. The player's face emerges from the darkness, the same rotten glow flickering across their face as they give a cruel smile.

PostBattleDarkUrge_89.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_89.text: My apologies, Father. Of course I accept.

PostBattleDarkUrge_21.text: I don't need any of this. The only family I know are those who fight by my side.

PostBattleDarkUrge_31.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_31.text: You were made to conquer. To devour.
PostBattleDarkUrge_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bhaal's eyes turn to fury. The player puts a hand to their nose, and sees blood on their fingers. Blood starts to trickle, then surge from their nose, eyes, ears. Jagged cuts open on their exposed skin. They are being drained.

PostBattleDarkUrge_91.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_91.text: You reject my blood, and so I will reclaim it.
PostBattleDarkUrge_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player falls to their knees, losing consciousness.The blood runs away from them along carved grooves in the floor. It flows into the pool, pouring down into the reflected image of Bhaal and baptising him

PostBattleDarkUrge_25.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_25.text: I will make another who is worthy.
PostBattleDarkUrge_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player drops to their knees, and then invisible forces raise them into the air, as happened to the butler. The pool of blood loses its reflection right after Bhaal speaks his final words in this node.

PostBattleDarkUrge_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: A tragic beat on the player's face, terrified, as knives manifest in the air around them. Cut to black as the flesh-cutting sounds begin.

PostBattleDarkUrge_70.text: I obey, Father. This world will be eviscerated.

PostBattleDarkUrge_17.text: This is not my purpose. I will choose my own path.

PostBattleDarkUrge_68.text: I live to serve your will, Father. I accept your gift.

PostBattleDarkUrge_72.text: I'd rather die than live in your bloody image.

PostBattleDarkUrge_56.text: I need no further gifts. You have tainted me enough.

PostBattleDarkUrge_49.text: I'm honoured, Father. I accept your gift.

PostBattleDarkUrge_14.text: I refuse. I will be free of you.

PostBattleDarkUrge_11.text: I accept your gift, Lord Bhaal.

PostBattleDarkUrge_37.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_37.text: The Slayer form will be yours. Made crueller. Stronger. The prime incarnation of murder.

PostBattleDarkUrge_67.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_67.text: *It seems impossible to stand against your Father. But you have fought this long against your nature - there might just be a way...*

PostBattleDarkUrge_62.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_62.text: Child of slaughter. I come to give you your inheritance.

PostBattleDarkUrge_77.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
PostBattleDarkUrge_77.text: Oh my failed Master. My heart has never known such sorrow... Now, it breaks.
PostBattleDarkUrge_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Butler stands over the Dark Urge's corpse, mourning, begins to shake as his heart is literally going to break in a couple nodes.

PostBattleDarkUrge_69.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
PostBattleDarkUrge_69.text: He is near... He comes for you.
PostBattleDarkUrge_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: The butler smiles, his body beginning to vibrate, and jerk strangely. The light in the room flickers, as an evil wind begins to blow. The party looks around, uncertain.NodeContext: Butler's body beginning to vibrate, and jerk strangely

PostBattleDarkUrge_15.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The butler levitates, held up in the air like a broken marionette on invisible strings. Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

PostBattleDarkUrge_64.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_64.text: You were not strong enough, child.
PostBattleDarkUrge_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The avatar of Bhaal speaks from within the pool, and the Dark Urge's corpse levitates, hanging like a broken marionette

PostBattleDarkUrge_93.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_93.text: A creature of destruction, made to devour. You lost your appetite.
PostBattleDarkUrge_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player's corpse still hangs.

PostBattleDarkUrge_76.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_76.text: You will live. My blood will thicken in your veins.
PostBattleDarkUrge_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player's eyes snap open, flitting wildly as the player realises they have no control of their body

PostBattleDarkUrge_23.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_23.text: You will feel my hunger. My craving. Never to be satisfied.
PostBattleDarkUrge_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player's face contorts - whether struggling against their immobility, or feeling the urge Bhaal describees - we cannot say.

PostBattleDarkUrge_32.speaker: Bhaal Avatar
PostBattleDarkUrge_32.text: An impotent Urge for a wasted Chosen. When you succumb, I will create another.
PostBattleDarkUrge_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player continues to struggle. Bhaal allows the faintest smile to cross his lips. When he finishes speaking, the reflection fades. NodeContext: Ominous - alluding to Bhaal's future return

PostBattleDarkUrge_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: A tragic beat on the player's face, terrified, as knives manifest in the air around them. Cut to black as the flesh-cutting sounds begin.

DeathsHead_04_0.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Derysia
DeathsHead_04_0.text: We were to... to kill... killchokemaimburn... for the Chosen... for Him...
DeathsHead_04_0.context: NodeContext: middle italicised phrase spoken in one, hasty breath - they have looked upon their god

DeathsHead_04_3.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Derysia
DeathsHead_04_3.text: We... bleed... bleedchokeburnmaim... for the Chosen... for Bhaal.
DeathsHead_04_3.context: NodeContext: middle italicised phrase spoken in one, hasty breath - they have looked upon their god

DeathsHead_04_4.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Derysia
DeathsHead_04_4.text: Bleed... burn... choke... maim... for you... for Bhaal... kill them all.
DeathsHead_04_4.context: NodeContext: Heavy, breathy - as though they can only get out one word per exhale

DeathsHead_04_5.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Derysia
DeathsHead_04_5.text: We were to bleed... bleedchokemaimkill... for... you her Him...
DeathsHead_04_5.context: NodeContext: Heavy, breathy - as though they can only get out one word per exhale

ExamineAbductee_4.speaker: Narrator
ExamineAbductee_4.text: *Orin's chains still bind your companion to her bloody altar. *

ExamineAbductee_3.speaker: Narrator
ExamineAbductee_3.text: *These bloody chains restrain their victim through a locking mechanism within the altar.*

ExamineAbductee_2.speaker: Narrator
ExamineAbductee_2.text: *Your bound companion's arrhythmic breathing moves the chains slightly. At least they are still alive - for now.*

Cultist_01_0.speaker: Night Blade Elda
Cultist_01_0.text: Shhh. Silence is good. No screaming. No crying. No pleading. No air escapes.
Cultist_01_0.context: NodeContext: Manic/ unclear if she's talking to self or to the player

Cultist_01_4.speaker: Night Blade Elda
Cultist_01_4.text: When I squeeze, I make sure they're quiet. I made them all quiet now.
Cultist_01_4.context: NodeContext: Manic/ unclear if she's talking to self or to the player. Referring to victims she strangled

Cultist_01_1.speaker: Narrator
Cultist_01_1.text: *The cultist refuses to speak further. It seems she doesn't want to waste her breath.*

Cultist_01_3.speaker: Night Blade Elda
Cultist_01_3.text: Her screams, so loud. Should have cut them off. Squeezed harder. Still, she is silent now.
Cultist_01_3.context: NodeContext: Manic/ unclear if she's talking to self or to the player

Cultist_01_5.speaker: Night Blade Elda
Cultist_01_5.text: Shhh... Speak not. Silence is precious, to die for - and Lady Orin is already too loud.

Cultist_01_2.speaker: Night Blade Elda
Cultist_01_2.text: Always talking... She speaks of you. Of a duel. Are you going to choke her prattle away? Make her quiet for us? Yes, quiet...
Cultist_01_2.context: NodeContext: Manic/ unclear if she's talking to self or to the player

AD_AdmiringKill_02_5.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
AD_AdmiringKill_02_5.text: Tell me then - what is the point of murder if not to eat it whole?

AD_AdmiringKill_02_10.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
AD_AdmiringKill_02_10.text: You make it a spectacle for Lord Bhaal.

AD_AdmiringKill_02_9.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
AD_AdmiringKill_02_9.text: The sacrament of murder is to be devoured, savoured.

AD_AdmiringKill_02_3.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
AD_AdmiringKill_02_3.text: Besides, is the feast not the greatest spectacle of them all?

AD_AdmiringKill_02_7.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
AD_AdmiringKill_02_7.text: Surely there must be more to murder than a meal?

AD_AdmiringKill_02_8.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
AD_AdmiringKill_02_8.text: Look upon this altar. Orin's handiwork - do you not see the art here?

AD_AdmiringKill_02_0.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
AD_AdmiringKill_02_0.text: You show me this corpse, I see meat. Well-butchered, to be sure, but meat nonetheless.

AD_AdmiringKill_02_12.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
AD_AdmiringKill_02_12.text: Truly, Lady Orin's kills are something to behold.

AD_AdmiringKill_02_11.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
AD_AdmiringKill_02_11.text: Orin is wasteful in her slaughter. Undisciplined.

AD_AdmiringKill_02_13.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
AD_AdmiringKill_02_13.text: You would dare criticise the Lady of Murder? In her ancestor's temple?

AD_AdmiringKill_02_1.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
AD_AdmiringKill_02_1.text: Orin plays with her food, and barely eats it. I don't see the point.

AD_AdmiringKill_02_6.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
AD_AdmiringKill_02_6.text: I see, you're hungry. May I recommend biting your tongue, in case she hears you?

AD_AdmiringKill_02_14.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Horriss
AD_AdmiringKill_02_14.text: I simply wish a scrap of the Profane Lady's slaughter was left for us.

AD_AdmiringKill_02_15.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
AD_AdmiringKill_02_15.text: Not all of us share your... appetite. Murder alone fills my stomach, my being.

AD_AdmiringKill_02_2.speaker: Bhaal Cultist Bloodmopper
AD_AdmiringKill_02_2.text: And to watch Lady Orin at work... Why, that would sate me for an eternity.

UnholyAssassin_01_0.speaker: Unholy Assassin Rycke
UnholyAssassin_01_0.text: Do you crave my promised poison? Patience. Perhaps one day.
UnholyAssassin_01_0.context: NodeContext: Assessing, weighing you up by eye in order to work out how to poison you

UnholyAssassin_01_1.speaker: Unholy Assassin Rycke
UnholyAssassin_01_1.text: Oh, don't come to me for advice. I'd have poisoned Orin a tenday ago were I in your shoes.
UnholyAssassin_01_1.context: NodeContext: Detached, doesn't really care if you live or not

UnholyAssassin_01_2.speaker: Unholy Assassin Rycke
UnholyAssassin_01_2.text: So messy... All you really needed was a drop of adder bile. That would've done for Orin.

UnholyAssassin_01_4.speaker: Unholy Assassin Rycke
UnholyAssassin_01_4.text: Hmmm. Yes, at your stature, with your constitution...
UnholyAssassin_01_4.context: NodeContext: Assessing, weighing you up by eye in order to work out how to poison you

UnholyAssassin_01_3.speaker: Unholy Assassin Rycke
UnholyAssassin_01_3.text: An ounce of hezrou bile, two spoons of wyvern blood, and a corpse flower's nectar. That would do.
UnholyAssassin_01_3.context: NodeContext: Figuring out the solution to a problem

UnholyAssassin_01_5.speaker: Unholy Assassin Rycke
UnholyAssassin_01_5.text: The prodigal child returns - to duel Lady Orin, no less. I normally abhor theatrics, but that'll be quite the spectacle.
UnholyAssassin_01_5.context: NodeContext: Detached, doesn't really care if you live or not

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_17.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_15.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_15.text: Yenna... I didn't want this to happen.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_10.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_10.text: Who can I inform of your death?

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_1.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_1.text: What can I do to honour your memory?

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_6.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_6.text: What did you want to be when you grew up?

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_3.speaker: Narrator
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_20.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_22.speaker: Narrator
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_Dead_22.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_10.text: You shouldn't have come here. You can't win...
InWorldAbduction_Minthara_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stops, confused, as Minthara comes lurching towards them from the darkness of the undercity. She is bloodied, bruised, clutching a wound on her side - something terrible has happened to her. In the distance, we hear a strange giggle (Orin).NodeContext: Shocked, worried

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_20.text: I cut her - I cut her and cut her and cut her, but the more she bled, the harder she fought.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_9.text: I could bleed an ocean and it would not be enough to sate the one I hunted here.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_17.text: Orin. Orin the Red. Bhaal's bitch. His Chosen.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_22.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Minthara_22.text: What are you doing down here?

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_24.text: What needed to be done. Hunting our prey.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_3.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Minthara_3.text: I'll protect you from whatever's coming.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_1.text: You can't. It's Orin. Bhaal's Bitch.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_19.text: She's too strong here. His temple is close, and she draws power from it. I intended to slaughter her there, before her Lord's eyeless gaze.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_0.text: I didn't just come here to kill Orin - I came here to take her place at Bhaal's side.
InWorldAbduction_Minthara_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Another giggle. This one louder. Closer. (Orin). Minthara coughs up blood, then looks up at you smiling wickedly

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_13.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Minthara_13.text: You intended to become Bhaal's chosen? What the hell, Minthara!

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_6.text: Why so surprised? Minthara murdered her way out of the womb.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_16.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Minthara_16.text: Then you're no better than her - you deserve to die.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_5.text: She does - she does! Chopped into messes and food for the rats.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_11.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Minthara_11.text: You would have made a fine chosen of Bhaal.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_7.text: But her skin will make a pretty-pretty tapestry.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_14.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Minthara_14.text: You were foolish to come alone.

InWorldAbduction_Minthara_4.text: Yes yes yes. Would have been better to bring more flesh, more blood, more victims.

OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_0.speaker: Orin
OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_0.text: That's it. No noise. Quiet as the grave you'll rot in.
OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_0.context: NodeContext: Childish, mocking, said while crouched over the unconscious abductee on the altar

OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_1.speaker: Orin
OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_1.text: In and out, up and down. So many places to puncture, and let the air leak out.
OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_1.context: NodeContext: Childish, mocking, said while crouched over the unconscious abductee on the altar. Describing their chest moving as they breathe.

OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_2.speaker: Orin
OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_2.text: A quick jab, a small slice and - no, no. Not yet.
OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_2.context: NodeContext: Tempted to kill the abductee now, then talking herself out of it

OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_3.speaker: Orin
OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_3.text: Come now - so sleepy. It will miss all the fun.
OrinPatrol_AD_ToyWithAbductee_3.context: NodeContext: Childish, mocking, said while crouched over the unconscious abductee on the altar

AD_AwakenAbductee_0.text: Orin... I will dissect her for laying her blade on me again.
AD_AwakenAbductee_0.context: NodeContext: Groggy at first, then determined, about to join combat

AD_AwakenAbductee_1.text: Where am I? I don't like this dream!
AD_AwakenAbductee_1.context: NodeContext: Waking up in a scary place from a deep, unnatural sleep. More active/scared - combat ongoing, running away

AD_AwakenAbductee_2.text: Orin... where is she? Not dead by another's hand, I hope.
AD_AwakenAbductee_2.context: NodeContext: Waking up from an unnatural sleep, groggy and confused

AD_AwakenAbductee_3.text: What - what happened? Where am I?
AD_AwakenAbductee_3.context: NodeContext: Waking up in a scary place from a deep, unnatural sleep

PostBattleAbductee_2.text: Did - did you die? Am I dead?

PostBattleAbductee_4.text: You - you came for me. That lady... she... she killed Grub.

PostBattleAbductee_6.text: If there is anything left of her, burn it. I do not trust her to stay dead.
PostBattleAbductee_6.context: NodeContext: exhausted from a terrible ordeal... scared - referring to Orin's corpse here

PostBattleAbductee_7.text: I don't like it here. I'm going home.

Reaper_06_0.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Dhoria
Reaper_06_0.text: With your failing Chosen, the absence of Bhaal's favour... You will die with the rest.

Reaper_06_1.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Dhoria
Reaper_06_1.text: Be sure to keep the Chosen's favour. Without it, you'll die with the rest of them.

Reaper_06_2.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Dhoria
Reaper_06_2.text: Spawn of Bhaal... You would've brough this city to its knees - you have squandered your unholy right.

Reaper_06_3.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Dhoria
Reaper_06_3.text: Of this city we will build you a pile, Chosen - a most horrible mound of corpses. A throne of your slaughter.

Reaper_06_4.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Dhoria
Reaper_06_4.text: Spawn of Bhaal... You will bring this city to its knees - as is your most unholy right.

Reaper_06_5.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Dhoria
Reaper_06_5.text: I sense you are ready... Embrace your fate. Face Lady Orin at the altar. Yes, yes, yes.

Reaper_06_6.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Dhoria
Reaper_06_6.text: We would've built you a pile, Chosen - a most horrible mound of corpses. A wet, weeping throne - but alas. No.

AD_ButlerDarkUrge_0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
AD_ButlerDarkUrge_0.text: Hither! O! Hither! My hot-shot champion, raring to slay!

AD_ButlerDarkUrge_1.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
AD_ButlerDarkUrge_1.text: Hither! O! Hither! Come, come! Sororicide awaits!

AD_ButlerDarkUrge_2.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
AD_ButlerDarkUrge_2.text: Away, away, louts! This is the property of your betters.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stops, confused, as Lae'zel comes lurching towards them from the darkness of the undercity. She is bloodied, bruised, clutching a wound on her side - something terrible has happened to her. In the distance, we hear a strange giggle (Orin).NodeContext: Shocked, worried

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_11.text: It's too late for me - but not for you. Run, as fast as your legs can carry you.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_18.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Laezel_18.text: First, tell me what you're doing down here.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_19.text: The shapeshifter - Orin the Red. She seized me from our camp, bore me here to Bhaal's enclave.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_3.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Laezel_3.text: Whatever you're running from, it holds no threat for me.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_8.text: Then your pride will be the death of you, as it will for me. Orin the Red approaches.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_4.text: She seized me from our camp, bore me here to Bhaal's enclave.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_23.text: She - she slit my belly and filled her cup with my blood. A toast, she said, to her false god.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_17.text: She told me when her cup ran dry, she'd come for the rest of me.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_7.text: I'm done for. I will hold her off as long as I'm able.  Run, while you still can! Don't even think about fighting her. This foe is too powerful.
InWorldAbduction_Laezel_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Another giggle. This one louder. Closer. (Orin). Lae'zel readies herself for a fight, clearly not in good shape to take on anyone, never mind Orin.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_12.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Laezel_12.text: Your sacrifice is a noble one. I will not forget it.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_9.text: You'd scuttle away so easily? To think I saw courage in you.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_0.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Laezel_0.text: I'm not leaving you behind. You're coming with us.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_21.text: Tsk. You'd let the githyanki weigh you down? She would make corpses of you all.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_5.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Laezel_5.text: You will not stand alone. We face her together.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_20.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Laezel_20.text: I will not run. I have no fear of Orin.

InWorldAbduction_Laezel_2.text: You'd underestimate Orin the Red? The last mistake you'll ever make.

LINE_DarkUrgeDefeated_1.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
LINE_DarkUrgeDefeated_1.context: InternalNodeContext: addressing DUNodeContext: Sobbing, fully broken down, a mess in every conceivable way.

LINE_DarkUrgeDefeated_0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
LINE_DarkUrgeDefeated_0.text: Get up. Please. Please. Get up. If you don't get up, you will be disinherited!

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_0.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_0.context: NodeContext: Terrified after being kidnapped by a killer.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_6.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_6.text: It's all right, Yenna. You're safe now.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_11.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_11.text: No. I'm not. I'm not ever safe. Ever again.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_7.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_7.text: There was an intruder in our camp. But she's gone now.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_2.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_2.text: I want my mum. I want to go home. I want this all to go away.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_12.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_12.text: If she does come back, I'm sticking her with my potato knife. Hard. She won't take me again.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_4.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_4.text: She's dangerous - she might find a way. But we're more dangerous.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_15.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_15.text: I... I don't feel good. I want my mum. I want to go home.
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_15.context: NodeContext: Sobbing after being kidnapped by a killer

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_14.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_14.text: Probably. And she has her sights set on you.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_5.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_5.text: Then I'll kill her! I will! She can't have me again. She won't!

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_3.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_3.text: You got grabbed by the bogey-woman. Hope she doesn't return for you.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_10.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_10.text: If she does... if she does I'll stab her. I have a knife. She can't have me again. She won't!

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_13.speaker: Player
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_13.text: Be honoured, a talented skin-peeler has eyes on your pathetic rind.

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_9.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_9.text: NO! No, don't let her! I won't let her grab me - I'll stab her! I will!

PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_8.speaker: Yenna
PostLaezelAbduction_Yenna_8.text: I'll kill her. I'll kill her! She can't grab me again - never ever!

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_0.speaker: Orin
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_0.text: The city bleeds quicker and quicker. Have more come to seek Bhaal's blessing?
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_0.context: NodeContext: Asking whether they've recruited more to Bhaal's cause. Shouldn't sound too business-like - she's Orin after all

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_1.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_1.text: As the city grows weaker, Bhaal's call grows stronger. More and more seek his sanctuary.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_6.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_6.text: The shadows fill with malcontents. The Murder Lord welcomes them all.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_2.speaker: Orin
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_2.text: The Faceless take their time. Do they still ravage the city?
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_2.context: NodeContext: Asking for a report on some of her minions who were sent out to terrorise the city.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_10.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_10.text: They spread carnage like a pox. Priests poisoning congregations. Mothers serving their own babes for supper.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_11.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_11.text: People are frightened. Vulnerable. Violent. Bhaal would savour such destruction.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_5.speaker: Orin
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_5.text: Such fresh meat on the altar. You must distract me.
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_5.context: NodeContext: Speaking to minions in the temple. Referring to victim on the altar, who she'd like to kill. Bossy.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_9.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_9.text: Perhaps the tale of my first kill? A mason, kind and encouraging. Took me for an apprentice.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_4.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Fustian
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_4.text: I stripped the flesh from his bones and carved my resignation into his skull. He accepted.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_8.speaker: Orin
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_8.text: Tell me, did the Banite squirm beneath your screws?
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_8.context: NodeContext: Referring to a spy sent by Gortash (not shown in game). Excited by the thought

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_7.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_7.text: Oh, we broke him, body and soul. Made a right mess of his hand. Peeled the skin from it myself.

OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_3.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
OrinPatrol_AD_TalkWithMinions_3.text: I dropped him outside the fort. Let Gortash see what happens to his nasty little spies.

PostBattle_26.speaker: Narrator
PostBattle_26.text: *A metallic tang fills the air as Orin's form is drained of life - ashes to ashes, blood to blood.*
PostBattle_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Human Orin falls to the ground and bubbles down into a pool of blood with a giggle. Giggle is being recorded in LOW_BhaalTemple_Orin

PostBattle_2.speaker: Narrator
PostBattle_2.text: *Your companion did not survive to witness your triumph - all life within was extinguished by Orin's blades. But you still live.*
PostBattle_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot tbc - possibly player reaction, sad thought to self

PostBattle_37.speaker: Narrator
PostBattle_37.text: *You have robbed another god of his Chosen.*

PostBattle_30.speaker: Player
PostBattle_30.text: Mourn your fallen ally. Swear his death will not be in vain.

PostBattle_42.speaker: Player
PostBattle_42.text: Mourn your fallen ally. Swear her death will not be in vain.

PostBattle_16.speaker: Player
PostBattle_16.text: Mourn the child you did not save. Swear her death will not be in vain.

PostBattle_31.speaker: Player
PostBattle_31.text: Stand back and admire a job well done.

PostBattle_48.speaker: Player
PostBattle_48.text: Reflect on your technique - it could have been better.

PostBattle_7.speaker: Player
PostBattle_7.text: Examine the blood with dismay - this will take forever to come out.

PostBattle_25.speaker: Narrator
PostBattle_25.text: *A glint of light on something in the blood catches your eye.*
PostBattle_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orin's dagger in the pool of blood where her corpse was.

PostBattle_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player picks up the dagger from the pool of blood.

PostBattle_17.speaker: Karlach
PostBattle_17.text: Oh, goodie. Now we can go see Gortash, dangle this stone in front of him, and watch him beg before we slit his throat... right?

PostBattle_4.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattle_4.text: The great Archduke is awaiting word of Orin's demise, no doubt.

PostBattle_27.text: Seek him out. He is all that stands between us and the elder brain.

PostBattle_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
PostBattle_5.text: Gortash will be delighted to hear of Orin's death, but be ready for anything when we report to him. If he is to betray us, that would be the time.
PostBattle_5.context: NodeContext: playing the role of advisor, and advising caution

PostBattle_18.speaker: Lae'zel
PostBattle_18.text: To Gortash, then. I'm sure his enthusiasm will be... boundless.

PostBattle_20.speaker: Wyll
PostBattle_20.text: We should pay Gortash a visit. Let's see if he keeps his word.

PostBattle_23.speaker: Shadowheart
PostBattle_23.text: Gortash will want to hear of this.

PostBattle_35.speaker: Gale
PostBattle_35.text: I'm sure Gortash will be eager to learn of his rival's demise.

PostBattle_36.speaker: Astarion
PostBattle_36.text: Time to pay Gortash another visit. I'm sure he'll want to know all about this.

PostBattle_49.speaker: Minsc
PostBattle_49.text: Gortash wanted this stone. If we must give it to him... may we wrap it in a fist?

PostBattle_51.speaker: Halsin
PostBattle_51.text: Gortash will be keen to hear of this.

PostBattle_34.speaker: Karlach
PostBattle_34.text: One more Chosen to go. Can't wait.

PostBattle_29.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattle_29.text: Another Bhaalspawn falls - leaving only the final Chosen.

PostBattle_43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
PostBattle_43.text: I wish there were time to celebrate her death, but one Chosen still stands. Gortash is our next target.
PostBattle_43.context: NodeContext: minor irritation, but complete commitment to the cause (of killing the Chosen)

PostBattle_45.speaker: Lae'zel
PostBattle_45.text: Only Bane's Chosen remains. Let us see he meets the same fate.

PostBattle_14.speaker: Wyll
PostBattle_14.text: Two Chosen down, one still to go. Shall we pay a visit to Gortash?

PostBattle_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PostBattle_0.text: Only one Chosen remains - and that's still one too many.

PostBattle_3.text: Find Gortash. And take his Netherstone.

PostBattle_9.speaker: Gale
PostBattle_9.text: Just one Chosen remains. Let's endeavour to make that none, shall we?

PostBattle_28.speaker: Astarion
PostBattle_28.text: Only one left to slaughter now. It's quite the habit we're building.

PostBattle_1.speaker: Minsc
PostBattle_1.text: Boo is enjoying this chasing of Chosen. Let us find the last, so he might take another trophy.

PostBattle_11.speaker: Halsin
PostBattle_11.text: Only one Chosen remains. For now.

PostBattle_44.text: Only one more remains, and then we will be ready to pursue the elder brain.

PostBattle_21.speaker: Player
PostBattle_21.text: Smile. Your own dark master will be pleased.

PostBattle_12.speaker: Player
PostBattle_12.text: Smile. Bhaal will rejoice in your slaughter here.

PostBattle_24.speaker: Player
PostBattle_24.text: Be content. Baldur's Gate may never be pure, but cutting out Bhaal's roots is a boon to nature.

PostBattle_19.speaker: Player
PostBattle_19.text: Bring on the next. You'll cut them all down to size.

PostBattle_41.speaker: Narrator
PostBattle_41.text: *The child did not survive to witness your triumph - all life within her was extinguished by Orin's blades. But you still live.*
PostBattle_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot tbc - possibly player reaction, sad thought to self

PostBattle_39.speaker: Narrator
PostBattle_39.text: *A metallic tang fills the air as the Slayer's form is drained of life - ashes to ashes, blood to blood.*
PostBattle_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin as slayer falls to the ground and bubbles down into a pool of blood with a giggle. Giggle is being recorded as node

OrinsMother_Dead_29.speaker: Narrator
OrinsMother_Dead_29.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

OrinsMother_Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
OrinsMother_Dead_30.context: InternalNodeContext: Note to cinematics: for this SWD, the corpse is inside an upright chamber (like an iron maiden) and we don't need to see it fall out of the container, so keep her SWD as she is.

OrinsMother_Dead_40.speaker: Player
OrinsMother_Dead_40.text: Why did you try to kill your own daughter?

OrinsMother_Dead_6.speaker: Player
OrinsMother_Dead_6.text: Why did you try to kill your own daughter?

OrinsMother_Dead_5.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_5.text: I... wanted... to be... Bhaal's... Chosen...

OrinsMother_Dead_38.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_38.text: Sarevok... told me... she... must be... my... offering...

OrinsMother_Dead_23.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_23.text: I... was... close... my hand... around... her throat...

OrinsMother_Dead_18.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_18.text: My... father... child... of Bhaal... executor... of... his... will...

OrinsMother_Dead_26.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_26.text: She... hid... a... blade... beneath... her pillow...

OrinsMother_Dead_9.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_9.text: Bled... me... from... a... hundred... wounds...

OrinsMother_Dead_35.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_35.text: Cut off... my hand... while... I... still... breathed...

OrinsMother_Dead_31.speaker: Player
OrinsMother_Dead_31.text: Did Orin know that Sarevok ordered you to kill her?

OrinsMother_Dead_10.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_10.text: No... she... worshipped... him... loved... him...

OrinsMother_Dead_36.speaker: Player
OrinsMother_Dead_36.text: Does Orin know that Sarevok ordered you to kill her?

OrinsMother_Dead_1.speaker: Orin's Mother Helena
OrinsMother_Dead_1.text: I tried... to kill... her... but she... killed me... first...

OrinsMother_Dead_25.speaker: Player
OrinsMother_Dead_25.text: Why were you put on display like this?

OrinsMother_Dead_3.speaker: Narrator
OrinsMother_Dead_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

OrinsMother_Dead_39.speaker: Narrator
OrinsMother_Dead_39.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

OrinsMother_Dead_41.speaker: Narrator
OrinsMother_Dead_41.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_16.text: No... you can't be here - it's not safe. She has my scent.
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stops, confused, as Halsin comes lurching towards them from the darkness of the undercity. He is bloodied, bruised, clutching a wound on his side - something terrible has happened to him. In the distance, we hear a strange giggle (Orin - emote recorded within Nested dialogue).NodeContext: Shocked, worried

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_1.text: Run. Do not stop until you feel sunlight and fresh air.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_10.text: It's just flesh. But my spirit... she did much worse to that.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_2.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_2.text: First, tell me what you're doing down here.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_17.text: Orin. She managed to seize me from our very own camp.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_4.text: She tormented me, with blades and hot irons. I resisted... but then she forced me to drink a foul brew - the rabid, cursed blood of all manner of beasts.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_13.text: I lost control. I felt the bear take over, blood-crazed... and she forced me into a cage. Along with... with children, taken from the streets.
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_13.context: NodeContext: Hushed horror. Can barely bring himself to say the last part.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_14.text: I was powerless to stop myself. Their screams. Her laughter. It's all I can hear. I do not deserve to see the sun again.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_9.text: She's too strong. You have to turn around. Go - let me buy you some time. She's coming for you.
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Another giggle. This one louder. Closer. (Orin). Halsin cocks his head back on hearing it, then readies himself for a fight, clearly not in good shape to take on anyone, never mind Orin.NodeContext: Resigned.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_23.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_23.text: Thank you. I won't forget this.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_5.text: You would offer thanks to a beast with a bellyful of orphan flesh?

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin long transforms into Orin.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_7.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_7.text: I'm not leaving you behind. You're coming with me.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_0.text: Fool. Rabid beasts must not be coddled - they must be put down.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_3.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_3.text: You will not stand alone. We face her together.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_15.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_15.text: I will not run. I have no fear of Orin.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_19.text: Then you are an even dumber beast than your druid friend.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_18.speaker: Player
InWorldAbduction_Halsin_18.text: Whatever you're running from, it holds no threat for me.

InWorldAbduction_Halsin_20.text: This is no threat. It is a certainty. Orin is coming.

PAD_FoundOrinsLetter_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundOrinsLetter_0.text: A letter from Orin. What does she want?

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_7.text: You are born anew. Cured of all distraction. Good.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_8.text: Orin's Netherstone is in our grasp, and now we must look ahead to the other - Gortash.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_12.speaker: Karlach
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_12.text: Oh, goodie. Now we can go see Gortash, dangle this stone in front of him, and watch him beg before we slit his throat... right?

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_11.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_11.text: The great Archduke is awaiting word of Orin's demise, no doubt.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_1.text: Gortash will be delighted to hear of Orin's death, but be ready for anything when we report to him. If he is to betray us, that would be the time.
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_1.context: NodeContext: playing the role of advisor, and advising caution

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_10.text: Seek him out. He is all that stands between us and the elder brain.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_16.speaker: Lae'zel
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_16.text: To Gortash, then. I'm sure his enthusiasm will be... boundless.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_13.speaker: Wyll
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_13.text: We should pay Gortash a visit. Let's see if he keeps his word.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_15.speaker: Shadowheart
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_15.text: Gortash will want to hear of this.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_6.speaker: Gale
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_6.text: I'm sure Gortash will be eager to learn of his rival's demise.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_2.speaker: Astarion
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_2.text: Time to pay Gortash another visit. I'm sure he'll want to know all about this.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_4.speaker: Minsc
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_4.text: Gortash wanted this stone. If we must give it to him... may we wrap it in a fist?

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_3.speaker: Halsin
PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_3.text: Gortash will be keen to hear of this.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_0.text: Find him. And take his Netherstone.

PostBattle_DarkUrgeGetStoneFirst_9.text: Congratulations. Your Father smiles upon you. But do not let filial piety distract you from our cause.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_10.context: InternalNodeContext: Withers would have awoken the victim if Orin hadn't killed them at this point.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_67.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_67.text: *For the first time in over a century, silence falls over the Bhaal Temple. No chants, no screams, no prayers.*
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: The DU is dead, corpse in the centre of the temple

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_70.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_70.text: *In the end, your own death brought you more joy than any you wrought on this land. You are slipping into peaceful oblivion.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_52.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge opens their eyes, sharp intake of breath

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_2.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_2.text: Thou hast defied Bhaal, thy liege and father, and in doing so hast earned a place among champions and heroes.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_3.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_3.text: But, alas, thy courage was in opposition to the divine cosmology that bound thee to the Lord of Murder.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_47.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_47.text: Thou art now faithless - godless - and doomed to wander the Fugue Plane for eternity.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_75.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_75.text: I will not permit that, though all the powers of life and death dictate that it should be so.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_57.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_57.text: I, too, still hold some power, and I invest a portion of it in thee, who hath challenged the gods and now liveth to tell of it.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_41.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_41.text: Thy fight is not over, and it is thy fight, for one who can look upon Bhaal and oppose him can survive any crisis.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Withers starts to magically heal the DU

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_73.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_73.text: So rise, Challenger of Gods, and prepare for battle once more. Death will not claim thee whilst I endure.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_27.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_27.text: A scribe, a seneschal - a keeper of records. And now, thine advocate, both here, and in the City of the Dead.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_80.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_80.text: I deserve to die - for all the evil I have done.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_79.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_79.text: The sole way to atone for thine actions is to do better, in a new dawn. That dawn has come.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_0.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_0.text: Thank you for giving me a second chance.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_13.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_13.text: I can only give what thou hast earned.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_1.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_1.text: Bhaal tried to extinguish thee, but his wrath is imprecise. He only succeeded in killing the part of thee he knew.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_91.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_91.text: The Urge that drove thee to terrible acts. The spark of brutality that made thee his.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_88.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_88.text: But there is a new part of you that hath grown during thy travels.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_15.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_15.text: That part, Bhaal could not extinguish. And so instead of destroying thee, he hath made thee anew.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_83.speaker: Astarion
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_83.text: He's right, you're no monster. You've saved me more times than I can count.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_40.speaker: Wyll
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_40.text: Was there ever any doubt? You are a champion. You overcome.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_7.speaker: Gale
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_7.text: Without you, I'd likely be long dead. Count me extremely grateful you're still here.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_78.speaker: Karlach
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_78.text: You did it. You're free. I'm so godsdamn proud of you!

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_20.speaker: Lae'zel
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_20.text: It must be said - because of you, I still breathe. Because of you, I still battle. I am not one to show gratitude, but - *ahem* - thank you.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_87.speaker: Shadowheart
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_87.text: I'd be worm food if it wasn't for you. Thank you.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_9.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_9.text: The heart of a saviour hath overshadowed the mind of a murderer.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_6.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_6.text: It took time, but at the last, thine independence of heart overshadowed thy murderous mind.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_11.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_11.text: I share thine enthusiasm. In mine own manner.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_76.speaker: Jaheira
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_76.text: A genuine pleasure to meet you again, my friend.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_76.context: NodeContext: Understated warmth - she's not overly sentimental, but is genuinely proud of us - we resisted our evil bloodline.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_38.speaker: Minsc
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_38.text: Minsc had his doubts about you, little Slayer, but Boo had none!

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_55.speaker: Lae'zel
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_55.text: A triumph most deserved. Well done.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_33.speaker: Shadowheart
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_33.text: You're the author of your own tale now - well done.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_50.speaker: Astarion
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_50.text: You get to start over. To be the person you want to be - not what someone else made you to be.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_63.speaker: Wyll
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_63.text: You fought, and you prevailed. Your future will be what you make of it.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_8.speaker: Gale
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_8.text: Congratulations. That was hard-fought and well-deserved. You're free.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_8.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Proud of a companion who faced down their demons

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_14.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_14.text: Greet the bloodless dawn, child of none.
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: DU stands again, looks towards the vacant symbol of Bhaal in the temple

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_72.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_72.text: I have no idea what to do.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_54.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_54.text: Thy path is clear. You must save Baldur's Gate.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_61.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_61.text: Our enemies don't stand a chance.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_28.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_28.text: Do not thank me - trust in thy courage, and the conviction of thy companions.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_81.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_81.text: As it was, so it is again.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_17.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_17.text: A hero has risen from a legacy of death.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_66.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_66.text: Worry - so much of your brain is beyond repair.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_37.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_37.text: *There is so little of you left.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_51.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_51.text: *There is nothing left to do, but write yourself anew.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_34.text: Relish: with Bhaal gone, your sins will at last be truly yours.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_36.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_36.text: *Now, you may yet rule, and rule unhindered, rid of your domineering Father.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_90.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_90.text: *For now they believe you sweet and innocent, having triumphed against such evil.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_29.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_29.text: *If you plan to command the world, no one will suspect a thing until it is too late.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_25.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_25.text: *After all, you have not been turned good.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_16.speaker: Narrator
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_16.text: *You can conduct atrocities whenever you please and get a peaceful night's sleep.*

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_23.speaker: Halsin
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_23.text: Well done - I knew your true nature remained, beneath those dark impulses. You are your true self, at last.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_5.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_5.text: Did you know my nature all this time?

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_39.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_39.text: I know all, but to state truths is to interfere, for the minds of mortals are easily swayed. My place, for the most part, is to observe.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_35.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_35.text: This intervention, the reclamation of thy soul, is beyond mine ordinary remit. But thou art extraordinary, and so are these times.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_12.text: My old memories and my past self - I can never get them back?

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_26.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_26.text: If thou couldst recall in full every barbarity thou hadst committed, every tragedy thou hadst authored... wouldst thou truly want to?

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_46.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_46.text: Better not to know. Better to forget.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_60.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_60.text: Nothing is ever truly forgotten - I will remember them always - but thou mayst turn thy mind to the future.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_42.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_42.text: It is a dishonour to my victims to not recall their names.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_22.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_22.text: All their names are written. One day, if thou truly wishest, I will show thee, and we shall remember them together.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_53.text: I think it would drive me mad.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_59.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_59.text: Indeed. And thou art recently cured of one form of madness - let us not exchange it for another.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_21.text: I just want to rest - death seemed so peaceful.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_74.speaker: Withers
PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_74.text: There is no true rest for those like thee, faithless. But when victory is won, I swear I shall find thee a home.

PostBattleDarkUrge_Resistance_18.context: InternalNodeContext: If Orin didn't kill them, Withers would have awoken them by this point.

DeathsHead_02_0.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_0.text: What will you do now, I wonder? With all of Bhaal's adherents at your command... Oh, the possibilities.
DeathsHead_02_0.context: NodeContext: imagining a world of slaughter at the player's wake

DeathsHead_02_1.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_1.text: You rejected your own blood. Your unholy provenance. You are no child of Bhaal.
DeathsHead_02_1.context: NodeContext: quivering, confused, shocked - yout turned down a boon from his god

DeathsHead_02_2.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_2.text: He allowed you - an unfaithful whelp - to behold him... Only for the Bastard Child of Murder to spurn him. Blasphemy.
DeathsHead_02_2.context: NodeContext: quivering, confused, shocked - yout turned down a boon from his god

DeathsHead_02_3.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_3.text: You were permitted to look upon a god, whelp. Count yourself lucky to walk with Bhaal's chosen.

DeathsHead_02_4.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_4.text: You are forsaken, Bastard Child of Murder. There is no place for you here.
DeathsHead_02_4.context: NodeContext: quivering, confused, shocked - yout turned down a boon from his god

DeathsHead_02_5.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_5.text: Truly a magnificent display of brutality. I expected nothing less of one of Bhaal's children.

DeathsHead_02_6.speaker: Invoker of Bhaal Hivune
DeathsHead_02_6.text: Only a fool would keep Lady Orin waiting. She is at the altar.

Reaper_01_0.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Liya
Reaper_01_0.text: I can smell it... Like rotted honey. Her anticiaption. Lady Orin awaits your presence.

Reaper_01_1.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Liya
Reaper_01_1.text: His bubbling hate still fills my nostrils... Not even your treason could dampen this joy, betrayer.
Reaper_01_1.context: NodeContext: after "chosen", take a deep, nasal breath in as if sniffing someone

Reaper_01_2.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Liya
Reaper_01_2.text: The scent of murder... such a heady perfume. Even in the face of betrayal.
Reaper_01_2.context: NodeContext: after "yes" take a deep, nasal breath in as if sniffing the air

Reaper_01_3.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Liya
Reaper_01_3.text: I am trying to enjoy the lingering scent of our lord... I need not your traitorous stench.
Reaper_01_3.context: NodeContext: creepy, loves the scent of blood

Reaper_01_4.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Liya
Reaper_01_4.text: We will spill the blood of a world for you, Chosen. Imagine the smell... intoxicating.
Reaper_01_4.context: NodeContext: creepy, loves the scent of blood

Reaper_01_5.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Liya
Reaper_01_5.text: Well met, Chosen. I smell Orin's blood on you - such a heady perfume.
Reaper_01_5.context: NodeContext: after "chosen", take a deep, nasal breath in as if sniffing someone

Reaper_01_6.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Liya
Reaper_01_6.text: Yesss - do you smell it? Orin's blood... such a heady perfume.
Reaper_01_6.context: NodeContext: after "yes" take a deep, nasal breath in as if sniffing the air

PAD_FindDarkUrgeBody_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FindDarkUrgeBody_0.text: Orin relished tormenting this poor soul.

PAD_EnterOrinsRoom_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnterOrinsRoom_0.text: We've found Orin's home base. And a house of horrors it is.

DeathsHead_03_0.speaker: Narrator
DeathsHead_03_0.text: *The Death's Head does not speak, only stares. Her eyes are full of awe, of reverence... of hunger.*

DeathsHead_03_1.speaker: Narrator
DeathsHead_03_1.text: *The Death's Head does not speak, only stares, eyes full of malevolence. And, perhaps, excitement.*

DeathsHead_03_2.speaker: Narrator
DeathsHead_03_2.text: *The Death's Head stares off to where Orin once stood - eyes brimming with loss.*

DeathsHead_03_3.speaker: Narrator
DeathsHead_03_3.text: *The Death's Head stares at you, eyes full of anticipation.*

DeathsHead_03_4.speaker: Narrator
DeathsHead_03_4.text: *The Death's Head does not speak, only stares. Her eyes are not only filled with zealous awe, but also pure hatred.*

DeathsHead_03_5.speaker: Narrator
DeathsHead_03_5.text: *The Death's Head does not speak, only stares, eyes full of malevolence. And, perhaps, excitement.*

MainDoor_3.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
MainDoor_3.text: Please bring forth the bearer of the Urge. Then we may all feast our eyes ogling their triumphs.

MainDoor_11.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
MainDoor_11.text: Oh, Master, Master, MASTER! You have come home to your royal dwelling!
MainDoor_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sceleritas bows lowlyNodeContext: Sceleritas bows lowly

MainDoor_43.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
MainDoor_43.text: But why did you exert yourself so getting here? I was waiting to open the door.

MainDoor_2.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
MainDoor_2.text: Don't lift a pinkie! I have been waiting to open the door for you.

MainDoor_90.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
MainDoor_90.text: Lady Orin told me to allow your passage, but if she hadn't I would have been naughty and slipped you inside anyway.

MainDoor_47.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
MainDoor_47.text: Lady Orin told me not to let you in, but I'd never listen to the pretender to your fetid throne.

MainDoor_97.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
